What You Will Do
All Lowe’s associates deliver quality customer service while maintaining a store that is clean, safe, and stocked with the products customers need. As a Customer Service Associate – Front End, this means:

The Customer Service Associate – Front End is responsible for delivering excellent customer service during the checkout process. This associate is one of the last interactions with our customer before leaving the store and needs to ensure the customer is satisfied and encouraged to come back to Lowe’s. Therefore, engaging with customers as well as attention to detail are extremely important in this role.

F&D recruits, hires, trains, promotes, compensates and administers all personnel actions without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sex stereotyping, pregnancy (which includes pregnancy, childbirth and medical conditions related to pregnancy, childbirth or breastfeeding), gender, gender identity, gender expression, national origin, age, mental or physical disability, ancestry, medical condition, marital status, military or veteran status, citizenship status, sexual orientation, genetic information or any other status protected by applicable law.
This policy applies to all areas of employment, including recruitment, testing, screening, hiring, selection for training, upgrading, transfer, demotion, layoff, discipline, termination, compensation, benefits and all other privileges, terms and conditions of employment. This policy and the law prohibit employment discrimination against any associate or applicant on the basis of any legally protected status outlined above.


**Up to $1,000.00 sign on bonus for new employee of EvergreenHealth***
Job Summary:
The Cook's Helper provides support services for cafeteria, production, and or patient care areas.
Positions include but are not limited to grill, cashier, deli, salad bar, nutrition services aid, pantry aide, and catering. Responsibilities include, but not limited to:
1. Preparation and serving of sufficient hot and cold food for patients, cafeteria and catering and/or mini deli areas.
2. Replenishing food and supplies in cafeteria, catering and/or patient food service areas.
3. Setting up catered functions and delivering coffee.
4. Cashing and keeping cash records.
5. Setting up, opening, and closing of cafeteria and/or mini deli.
6. Delivering and picking up tray carts on nursing units.
7. Delivering patient menus.
REQUIRED for the position:
High school graduate or equivalent combination of education and experience
A valid Washington State "Food and Beverage Workers" Permit
Knowledge of safety, sanitation and food-handling standards and practices.
1 year of recent food service and cashiering work experience OR any combination of experience and education that would demonstrate the capability to perform the duties
Must be able to effectively communicate with customers, fellow employees and other departments.
Ability to establish and maintain effective working relationships.
Ability to multi task in a fast paced, constantly changing environment
Capable of efficient time management.
Ability to provide excellent customer service.
Basic math skills (addition, subtraction, multiplication, division) for cash handling purposes.
Basic understanding of POS functionality.
This position is covered by a collective bargaining agreement between EvergreenHealth and the Service Employees International Union (SEIU) Healthcare 1199NW. Union membership is optional.

Schedule: Full Time, Varies, 40

What You Will Do
All Lowe’s associates deliver quality customer service while maintaining a store that is clean, safe, and stocked with the products customers need. As a Customer Service Associate – Front End, this means:
Delivering a checkout experience that is quick, professional, and friendly.
Ensuring merchandise is accurately accounted, scanned, and meets the needs of customers.
Engaging in safe work practices and encouraging others to do the same.
The Customer Service Associate – Front End is responsible for delivering excellent customer service during the checkout process. This associate is one of the last interactions with our customer before leaving the store and needs to ensure the customer is satisfied and encouraged to come back to Lowe’s. Therefore, engaging with customers as well as attention to detail are extremely important in this role.
Travel Requirements: This role does not require regular travel; however, this role may need to travel on occasion to meetings, trainings, or to support neighboring stores. What We're Looking For
Hourly Part Time: Generally scheduled up to 25 hours per week; more hours may be required based on the needs of the store.
Requires morning, afternoon and evening availability any day of the week.
Physical ability to perform tasks that may require prolonged standing, sitting, and other activities necessary to perform job duties.
Minimally must be able to lift 10 pounds without assistance; may lift over 10 pounds with or without assistance. What You Need To Succeed
Minimum Qualifications
6 months experience using a computer, including inputting, accessing, modifying, or outputting information.
6 months experience using a handheld device (e.g., mobile phone, LRT gun, palm pilot, tablet, iPod) to enter, access, and output information. Preferred Qualifications
6 months experience identifying and selling products based on customer needs, including credit cards, installations, add-on sales, and explaining warranties, product features, and benefits.
6 months retail experience.
6 months experience as a cashier.
If the state or local municipality requires a salesperson license for this position, you must either be licensed or pass the requisite licensing exam within sixty (60) days of starting employment in this position. Join a legendary team at McLendon Hardware. We pride ourselves on providing Legendary Customer Service to all of our customers. McLendon Hardware is "Where People Make the Difference." We seek out positive, energetic people who have the ability to build lifelong friendships and relationships with our customers. Our long-time Team Members are a testament to our commitment of employing folks who want to enjoy what they do, become an expert and join in teamwork to solve problems and provide our Legendary Customer Service to Every Customer, Every Time.
Cashier Position Description
Position Summary:
The primary responsibility of the Cashier is to process customer sales of retail hardware goods using McLendon's "Point of Sale" (POS) System, as well as provide McLendon's legendary customer service by greeting and directing customers to the products they are looking for. This position works under close supervision and must work closely with customers and other Team Members.
Essential Duties and Responsibilities:
Cashiering – Accurately uses POS screens and procedures to complete customer transactions, including, but not limited to, sales, special orders, gift certificates, invoicing, no tax and discounts. Receives accurate payment for merchandise in the form of cash, check, credit, debit, store account and other alternative tender. Follows all cash handling procedures, as well as accurately completes necessary paperwork. Knows and conveys the McLendon Hassle Free Return Policy.
Customer Service – Greets customers, acknowledges their presence and provides courteous, efficient and attentive service in a timely manner. Identifies customer needs and provides assistance with the handling of large or heavy items when necessary. Addresses customer questions and complaints, exercising tact and good judgment, including involving Cashier Lead, Head Cashier and/or Management, as required, to resolve customer issues.
Product Knowledge – General knowledge of merchandise carried and where it is located in order to direct customers.
Loss Prevention – Identifies counterfeit currency and shoplifting indicators.
Housekeeping – Keeps counter areas clean, neat, stocked and organized.
Other Duties:
Stocks and/or marks prices of nearby merchandise, as necessary and as time allows.
Puts away returned merchandise to store shelf in appropriate department.
Answers store phone.
Performs other duties as needed.
Qualifications:
One (1) year cashier experience preferred.
High school diploma or equivalent required.
Must be able to stand, walk, bend and lift merchandise up to 35 pounds for the majority of the workday.
Must be a quick learner.
Must have basic computer knowledge to include general typing and 10 key skills.
Must have the ability to read and write English and have proficient math skills.
Must be dependable. Due to the nature and responsibilities of this position, dependable regular attendance is required.

Barista
Dote’s baristas are responsible for delivering on our Company promise to create a welcoming place for the community to relax and connect. This role is responsible for all business execution during their shift including drink making, food service, cash handling, cleaning, display and awesome customer service.
Responsibilities
· Problem solve and use good judgment
· Set an example of top notch service and barista skills every day, including:
-Skilled drink making and coffee QC
-Deliver great service
-Welcome and thank every customer
-Offer customers samples, menu suggestions, and add-ons with a smile
-Uncompromising product quality every single time
-Keep calm and barista on when it gets busy
-Hustle to keep shop looking ‘clean & ready’ at all times (clean bar, clean
towels, no dishes, no crumbs, no clutter, hoppers full, pastries full, tags
displayed)
-Continually stock coffee, paper goods, pastries, retail coffee & chocolate as it’s purchased
-Operate cash register; follow cash handling procedures
-Wash bar equipment and dishes throughout your shift
-Keep shop inviting and clean: inside and out, front and back
-Follow health, safety, and sanitation guidelines with care
-Other duties as assigned
Qualifications
· Minimum 2 years barista or bartending experience required
· Positive personality
· Willingness to pick up shifts, as needed
· Have great communication skills and a professional, friendly attitude
·Retail or client/customer service experience a plus
· Be over 18 in order to work late nights.
Culture
This job is really fun with great co-workers and awesome customers. At times, this job, like any in a growing small business, is also stressful. The shop gets busy and stays busy so keeping your cool even when it’s hot in the shop is critical. Positive stress management attitudes and techniques, while working hard alongside the rest of the team, are a must.
Job Type: Full-time
Salary: $12.50 to $14.00 /hour
Experience:
Barista or Bartending: 2 years (Required)
Customer Service: 1 year (Preferred)

Description:
ALL ABOUT TARGET
As part of our collaborative and guest-obsessed team, you help us create an experience that makes guests say “I love Target!” When you work at Target, you’re helping every family discover the joy in everyday life. You’re working alongside a dedicated team that brings their passion and pride to all that they do. You delight our guests in all areas of the store ensuring each guest has an enjoyable experience in our smallest format stores.
ALL ABOUT SMALL FORMATS
We enable a consistent experience for our guests by ensuring product is in stock, available, accurately priced and signed on the sales floor in our smallest format stores. Experts of service, operations, process and efficiency. This team is responsible for being proficient in all areas of the store to complete duties such as, but not limited to, cashiering, stocking, presentation and price accuracy. You’ll provide exceptional guest service, customizing each experience and anticipating their needs.
At Target, we believe in our team members having meaningful experiences that help them build and develop skills for a career. The role of a Small Format Team Member can provide you with the:
Knowledge of guest service fundamentals and experience building a guest first culture across the store
Experience in retail business fundamentals: department sales trends, pricing and promotion strategies, inventory management, process efficiency and improvement
Experience supporting daily/weekly workload to support business priorities and deliver on sales goals
As a Small Format Team Member, no two days are ever the same, but a typical day will most likely include the following responsibilities:
Greet and service guests as you complete workload with minimal guest disruption
Work in all departments to ensure sales floor is full, zoned and in stock for guests
Push and stock product to sales floor
Execute adjacency changes, transitions, revisions and sales plans for all departments
Conduct weekly price change workload and ensure regular and promotional signing is set accurately for all departments
Complete scans and system audit functions to ensure inventory accuracy
Support execution of major transitions and in-store marketing (ISM)
Support guest services with cashiering, order pick up (OPU) and Drive Up (DU), where applicable
Accurately execute all pulls (i.e., daily autofills, CAFs, out of stock, manuals and guest requests) and backstock product from all departments
Process all inbound deliveries (using the receive application) to ensure inventory accuracy
Complete all backroom daily and weekly audits
Operate power equipment only if certified
Maintain backroom organization and location accuracy and follow equipment guidelines
Follow processes accurately with attention to detail, monitor own progress and accurately prioritize tasks
Provide service and a shopping experience that meets the needs of the guest
Demonstrate a culture of ethical conduct, safety, and compliance
Other duties based on business needs
WHAT WE ARE LOOKING FOR
We might be a great match if:
Working in a fun and energetic environment makes you excited… We work efficiently and as a team to deliver for our guests
Providing service to our guests that makes them say I LOVE TARGET! excites you… That’s why we love working at Target
Stocking, Setting and Selling Target products sounds like your thing… That’s the core of what we do
You aren’t looking for a Monday thru Friday job where you are at a computer all day… We are busy all day (especially on the weekends), making it easy for the guest to feel welcomed, inspired and rewarded
The good news is that we have some amazing training that will help teach you everything you need to know to be a Small Format Team Member. But there are a few skills you should have from the get-go:
Welcoming and helpful attitude toward guests and other team members
Learn and adapt to current technology needs
Work both independently and with a team
Resolve guest questions quickly on the spot
Attention to detail and follow a multi-step process
We are an awesome place to work and care about our teams, so we want to make sure we are clear on a few more basics that we expect:
Accurately handle cash register operations
Climb up and down ladders
Scan, handle and move merchandise efficiently and safely, including frequently lifting or moving merchandise up to 40 pounds
Flexible work schedule (e.g., nights, weekends and holidays) and regular attendance necessary
Roles Include:
Guest Advocate (Cashier)
General Merchandise
Inbound (Stocking)
Americans with Disabilities Act (ADA)
Target will provide reasonable accommodations (such as a qualified sign language interpreter or other personal assistance) with the application process upon your request as required to comply with applicable laws. If you have a disability and require assistance in this application process, please visit your nearest Target store or Distribution Center or reach out to Guest Services at 1-800-440-0680 for additional information. Qualifications:


What You Will Do
All Lowe’s associates deliver quality customer service while maintaining a store that is clean, safe, and stocked with the products our customers need. As a Head Cashier, this means:
Delivering a checkout experience that is quick, professional, and friendly.
Ensuring merchandise is accurately scanned and meets the needs of the customer.
Engaging in safe work practices and encouraging others to do the same.
The Head Cashier is responsible for providing excellent customer service during the checkout process. This associate is likely the last interaction with our customer before leaving the store and needs to ensure the customer is satisfied and encouraged to come back to Lowe’s. Therefore, engaging with customers as well as attention to detail are extremely important in this role. As Head Cashier, he/she provides supervision, coaching, and support to the Customer Service Associate - Front End Team. Depending on the specific work shift, this associate may also help open or close the front-end of the store.
Travel Requirements: This role does not require regular travel; however, this role may need to travel on occasion to meetings, trainings, or to support neighboring stores. What We're Looking For
Hourly Part Time: Generally scheduled up to 25 hours per week; more hours may be required based on the needs of the store.
Requires morning, afternoon and evening availability any day of the week.
Physical ability to perform tasks that may require prolonged standing, sitting, and other activities necessary to perform job duties.
Minimally must be able to lift 10 pounds without assistance; may lift over 10 pounds with or without assistance. What You Need To Succeed
Minimum Qualifications
6 months of experience using a computer, including inputting, accessing, modifying, or outputting information.
6 months of experience using a handheld device (e.g., mobile phone, LRT gun, palm pilot, tablet, iPod) to enter, access, and output information. Preferred Qualifications
1 year of experience identifying and selling products based on customer needs, including credit cards, installations, add-on sales, protection plans, and explaining warranties, product features, and benefits.
1 year of retail experience.
1 year of experience as a head cashier.
6 months experience working in any department at a Lowe's retail store.
1 year of supervisory experience in any field, including directing, delegating, evaluating, training, and coaching employees.
6 months of retail experience detecting common signs of shoplifting (e.g., merchandise hidden inside of containers, merchandise under carts, price labels switched).
1 year of retail experience as a cashier.
If the state or local municipality requires a salesperson license for this position, you must either be licensed or pass the requisite licensing exam within sixty (60) days of starting employment in this position. **Up to $1,000.00 sign on bonus for new employee of EvergreenHealth***
Job Summary:
The Cook's Helper provides support services for cafeteria, production, and or patient care areas.
Positions include but are not limited to grill, cashier, deli, salad bar, nutrition services aid, pantry aide, and catering. Responsibilities include, but not limited to:
1. Preparation and serving of sufficient hot and cold food for patients, cafeteria and catering and/or mini deli areas.
2. Replenishing food and supplies in cafeteria, catering and/or patient food service areas.
3. Setting up catered functions and delivering coffee.
4. Cashing and keeping cash records.
5. Setting up, opening, and closing of cafeteria and/or mini deli.
6. Delivering and picking up tray carts on nursing units.
7. Delivering patient menus.

indi chocolate is the bean to bar chocolate maker of Pike Place Market with their factory, cafe, and gathering space located in the heart of Seattle. The space is beautiful and bright, where people can look inside the chocolate factory to see how single origin cacao beans are transformed into delicious dark chocolate bars. In addition to dark chocolate and chocolate confections, indi chocolate has differentiated chocolate products and serves specialty coffee and innovative beverages and food in their cafe.
The cafe menu includes cacao tea blends and drinks made with our single origin chocolate. Freshly toasted house marshmallows are available to top our cafe creations. At indi our baristas and team members are encouraged to help create intriguing new items to our cafe menu!
.
.
Excellent customer service and the ability to positively impact the communities where we work is important to indi chocolate.

Want an opportunity to join the indi chocolate team?
We are seeking creative, passionate, and self motivated people to work in our cafe as Barista and Retail Consultant and to help us achieve our goal of crafting a delightful one-of-a-kind experience; engaging with our local community through events and educational classes, and crafting something memorable for locals and those visiting from all over the world by sharing our process, products and our knowledge with them.
We got our start in 2010 selling a unique range of products all made from cacao; from body lotions to spice rubs, and have expanded into our current chocolate factory cafe space where we have the unique opportunity to let the public see the entire chocolate making process right in our shop.

Job Summary 
Summary: Performs cashiering duties, including general food service work. Maintains sanitation standards in the preparation, service and dining room facilities. Essential Duties and Responsibilities:
Performs prep work such as washing, peeling, cutting and seeding fruits and vegetables. Weighs and measures designated ingredients.
Carries pans, kettles and trays of food to and from work stations, stove and refrigerator in accordance with safety standards. Distributes supplies, utensils and portable equipment.
Stores foods in designated areas in accordance with wrapping, dating, and food safety and rotation procedures.
Cleans work areas, equipment and utensils.
Ensures compliance with sanitation and safety requirements.
Uses approved food recipes and production standards to ensure proper quality, serving temperatures and standard portion control.
Serves customers in a friendly, efficient manner following outlined steps of service.
Interacts with customers and resolves customer complaints in a friendly, service-oriented manner.
Relays relevant information to supervisor.
Performs sales transactions.
Enters sales into the cash register to ensure purchases are accurately recorded.
Makes change, accepts declining balance cards and other acceptable forms of payment.
Issues receipts to customers.
Follows standard procedures for issuing cash refunds.
Responsible for all assigned change funds and cash receipts, ensuring that cash drawer is in compliance with overage/shortage standards.
Replenishes condiments, beverages and general supplies while maintaining service area cleanliness.
Performs other duties as assigned.

Join a legendary team at McLendon Hardware. We pride ourselves on providing Legendary Customer Service to all of our customers. McLendon Hardware is "Where People Make the Difference." We seek out positive, energetic people who have the ability to build lifelong friendships and relationships with our customers. Our long-time Team Members are a testament to our commitment of employing folks who want to enjoy what they do, become an expert and join in teamwork to solve problems and provide our Legendary Customer Service to Every Customer, Every Time.
Cashier Position Description
Position Summary:
The primary responsibility of the Cashier is to process customer sales of retail hardware goods using McLendon's "Point of Sale" (POS) System, as well as provide McLendon's legendary customer service by greeting and directing customers to the products they are looking for. This position works under close supervision and must work closely with customers and other Team Members.
Essential Duties and Responsibilities:
Cashiering – Accurately uses POS screens and procedures to complete customer transactions, including, but not limited to, sales, special orders, gift certificates, invoicing, no tax and discounts. Receives accurate payment for merchandise in the form of cash, check, credit, debit, store account and other alternative tender. Follows all cash handling procedures, as well as accurately completes necessary paperwork. Knows and conveys the McLendon Hassle Free Return Policy.
Customer Service – Greets customers, acknowledges their presence and provides courteous, efficient and attentive service in a timely manner. Identifies customer needs and provides assistance with the handling of large or heavy items when necessary. Addresses customer questions and complaints, exercising tact and good judgment, including involving Cashier Lead, Head Cashier and/or Management, as required, to resolve customer issues.
Product Knowledge – General knowledge of merchandise carried and where it is located in order to direct customers.
Loss Prevention – Identifies counterfeit currency and shoplifting indicators.
Housekeeping – Keeps counter areas clean, neat, stocked and organized.
Other Duties:
Stocks and/or marks prices of nearby merchandise, as necessary and as time allows.
Puts away returned merchandise to store shelf in appropriate department.
Answers store phone.
Performs other duties as needed.
Qualifications:
One (1) year cashier experience preferred.
High school diploma or equivalent required.
Must be able to stand, walk, bend and lift merchandise up to 35 pounds for the majority of the workday.
Must be a quick learner.
Must have basic computer knowledge to include general typing and 10 key skills.
Must have the ability to read and write English and have proficient math skills.
Must be dependable. Due to the nature and responsibilities of this position, dependable regular attendance is required.


What You Will Do
All Lowe’s associates deliver quality customer service while maintaining a store that is clean, safe, and stocked with the products customers need. As a Customer Service Associate – Front End, this means:
Delivering a checkout experience that is quick, professional, and friendly.
Ensuring merchandise is accurately accounted, scanned, and meets the needs of customers.
Engaging in safe work practices and encouraging others to do the same.
The Customer Service Associate – Front End is responsible for delivering excellent customer service during the checkout process. This associate is one of the last interactions with our customer before leaving the store and needs to ensure the customer is satisfied and encouraged to come back to Lowe’s. Therefore, engaging with customers as well as attention to detail are extremely important in this role.
Travel Requirements: This role does not require regular travel; however, this role may need to travel on occasion to meetings, trainings, or to support neighboring stores. What We're Looking For
Hourly Full Time or Part Time: Generally scheduled 39 to 40 or up to 25 hours per week, respectively; more hours may be required based on the needs of the store.
Requires morning, afternoon and evening availability any day of the week.
Physical ability to perform tasks that may require prolonged standing, sitting, and other activities necessary to perform job duties.
Minimally must be able to lift 10 pounds without assistance; may lift over 10 pounds with or without assistance. What You Need To Succeed
Minimum Qualifications
6 months experience using a computer, including inputting, accessing, modifying, or outputting information.
6 months experience using a handheld device (e.g., mobile phone, LRT gun, palm pilot, tablet, iPod) to enter, access, and output information. Preferred Qualifications
6 months experience identifying and selling products based on customer needs, including credit cards, installations, add-on sales, and explaining warranties, product features, and benefits.
6 months retail experience.
6 months experience as a cashier.
If the state or local municipality requires a salesperson license for this position, you must either be licensed or pass the requisite licensing exam within sixty (60) days of starting employment in this position. ISSAQUAH SCHOOL DISTRICT JOB DESCRIPTION
TITLE: Food Service Baker/Cashier DEPARTMENT: Food Service Department
*
REPORTS TO: *Director of Food Services
POSITION SUMMARY: The Food Service Baker/Cashier is responsible for completion of all baking functions as well as all cashier responsibilities.
ESSENTIAL FUNCTIONS:
 Collect money and tickets for the daily lunch.
 Supervise the use of tickets in the line.
 Collect and verify all money collected during the day and prepare deposit.
 Complete the daily meal and cash report necessary to produce the monthly state and federal reimbursement reports.
 Maintain the complete financial records for the food service site.
 Communicate known changes regarding free and reduced applications to the food service office.
 Prepare quick breads, yeast breads and desserts according to standardized recipes.
 Operate necessary kitchen equipment. (mixers, ovens, etc.)
 Assist Manager in adapting recipes to fit needed quantities.
 Order and maintain necessary baker and cashier supplies.
 Maintain the highest standards of sanitation and safety in the kitchen.
 Possess knowledge of and adhere to Governing Policies and District Regulations and Procedures.
 Participate in special projects as assigned and perform related duties and key responsibilities consistent with the scope and intent of the position.
 Perform other duties as assigned.
QUALIFICATIONS:
EDUCATION: High school diploma or equivalent.
EXPERIENCE: Job related experience is preferable.
ABILITIES: Ability to lift 25 – 30 pounds on a regular basis
REQUIRED TESTING: None specified

CLEARANCES: Criminal Justice fingerprint/Background Clearance
FLSA STATUS: Non-exempt

Looking for server who has great customer service skills, flexible schedule and the desire to grow with a company that is a institution in the area.  Must have food handlers card and mast card to be considered for position.  This position is part time.
Job Type: Part-time


Love cars? Love people? Tired of working a job where every day looks exactly the same? Come work at a place where your job will never be boring. We are a family-owned auto repair shop and gas station (the old-fashioned kind!). Our shop is always very busy and there is never a dull moment – one moment you may be pumping someone’s gas, the next you may be doing an emissions test or fixing a headlight. This is not the kind of gas station where you’ll sit behind a cash register all day.
This job is for you if:
You love problem solving and working with people
You love the idea of learning about cars, but you don’t necessarily want to be a mechanic
You like to have fun and want to work in a business where you can be part of a family
You are a self starter – you always keep looking for the next thing that needs to be done
You enjoy variety in your work and don’t mind trying new things
You want to work somewhere where you can get to know your customers by name (and they’ll know you too)
You’re over 18 years old
You have a valid driver’s license
Some basic job duties of this position:
Explain vehicle recommendations to customers picking up their vehicle
Check in customers dropping off their vehicle
Stock c-store products
Check in deliveries
Answer phones
Schedule appointments
Cashier for fuel customers
Perform full-service fueling
Perform emissions tests
Perform light-duty mechanical work (headlights, batteries, etc…training provided)
This position is generally from 9AM-5PM, 3-4 days per week. Applicants should plan on one shift per week being a weekend shift. Opportunities for advancement are available.
Learn more about us at www.gascan.com

Overview:
Main responsibilities of a cashier:
Managing transactions, making sure pricing is accurate
Accepting payments and providing receipts
Bagging purchased goods Cashier Job Description: We are looking for a qualified and responsible cashier to manage all transactions with our customers efficiently and accurately. A good job candidate is a person who knows their way around a cash register and can easily operate it, together with a product scanner. Their main responsibilities include accepting payments and providing receipts, making sure all transactions run smoothly and every customer is satisfied with the service. The cashier we would like to employ must be able to interact with our customers in a friendly manner, and provide assistance should any customer require it. Excellent communication skills are paramount to help us continue to delight our customers and provide them with an outstanding experience. A qualified candidate must also be able to follow instructions and be a successful member of our team. Company Introduction:
It all started with $1,100 and a dream for Ben and Dorthy Haggen and Doug Clark when they opened their first store in 1933 in Bellingham, Washington. For over more than 80 years, Haggen has been passionate about serving our customers with freshness and quality—that’s why we continuously strive to cultivate talented, dedicated associates who share our passion for bringing guests the freshest, local products possible with genuine service while building a sustainable local food economy and supporting our communities. We’re a local neighborhood grocer who strives to sustain partnerships with our local farmers, ranchers, fisheries and businesses that supply our stores to bring the very best to our community markets. We are proud to offer fresh, local produce, sustainable seafood, fresh meat, a scratch made bakery, a vibrant delicatessen and a wide assortment of organic, gluten free, local and specialty items.

Looking for server who has great customer service skills, flexible schedule and the desire to grow with a company that is a institution in the area.  Must have food handlers card and mast card to be considered for position.  This position is part time.
Job Type: Part-time


Duties
Summary
The primary function of this position is to perform hostess/cashiering tasks. Incumbent greets guests, escorts them to table, alerting server that table has been seated.
Responsibilities
The primary function of this position is to perform hostess/cashiering tasks. Incumbent greets guests, escorts them to table, alerting server that table has been seated. Coordinate activities involved in setting up for parties/catered events. May make table reservations for patrons as appropriate. Incumbent responsibilities include preparation of menu boards, secure supplies, etc. for operation of facility. Ensures adequate change fund is on hand; takes food and drink orders from patrons. Assist in maintaining good order and discipline. Answer patron’s questions in pleasant, courteous manner. Ensure proper preparation, display and price marking of items and adherence to correct receipt and pricing procedures. Maintains sales records and inventory on daily basis. Follow procedure for safeguarding cash. Ensure compliance with fire, safety, sanitation and security regulations. Incumbent will perform some housekeeping duties, including washing dishes, sweeping floors, wiping down tables and taking out trash. Rings sales and/or ticket sales by individual items, totals the sales, receives money, and makes change. Incumbent is responsible for turning in receipts at the end of each shift. Monitors operation of assigned area of responsibility, periodically checking to identify and resolve problems which may arise. Enforce rules. Handle all phone inquiries. Incumbent ensures customer satisfaction. Perform other duties as assigned.

Not required

No

: Incumbent required attendance of sanitation training course to obtain a valid health card.
Offer of employment contingent upon successful completion of National Agency Check (NACI) background check.
Availability to include work on evenings, weekend and holidays may be required.
Qualifications
Must have working knowledge of cash register operation and sales. Must be neat in appearance with ability to work with the public. Employee must complete operational duties with accuracy and efficiency to ensure smooth operation of the business and patron satisfaction. Work is primarily standing; however, some walking, carrying and light lifting (15-25 lbs.) is occasionally required in support of special events and functions.

The Cook's Helper provides support services for cafeteria, production, and or patient care areas. Positions include but are not limited to grill, cashier, deli, salad bar, nutrition services aid, pantry aide, and catering. Responsibilities include, but not limited to: 1. Preparation and serving of sufficient hot and cold food for patients, cafeteria and catering and/or mini deli areas. 2. Replenishing food and supplies in cafeteria, catering and/or patient food service areas. 3. Setting up catered functions and delivering coffee. 4. Cashing and keeping cash records. 5. Setting up, opening, and closing of cafeteria and/or mini deli. 6. Delivering and picking up tray carts on nursing units. 7. Delivering patient menus.
REQUIRED for the position:
High school graduate or equivalent combination of education and experience
A valid Washington State "Food and Beverage Workers" Permit
Knowledge of safety, sanitation and food-handling standards and practices.
1 year of recent food service and cashiering work experience OR any combination of experience and education that would demonstrate the capability to perform the duties
Must be able to effectively communicate with customers, fellow employees and other departments.
Ability to establish and maintain effective working relationships.
Ability to multi task in a fast paced, constantly changing environment
Capable of efficient time management.
Ability to provide excellent customer service.
Basic math skills (addition, subtraction, multiplication, division) for cash handling purposes.
Basic understanding of POS functionality.
This position is covered by a collective bargaining agreement between EvergreenHealth and the Service Employees International Union (SEIU) Healthcare 1199NW. Union membershp is optional.

The Cook's Helper provides support services for cafeteria, production, and or patient care areas.

Barista
Dote’s baristas are responsible for delivering on our Company promise to create a welcoming place for the community to relax and connect. This role is responsible for all business execution during their shift including drink making, food service, cash handling, cleaning, display and awesome customer service.
Responsibilities
· Problem solve and use good judgment
· Set an example of top notch service and barista skills every day, including:
-Skilled drink making and coffee QC
-Deliver great service
-Welcome and thank every customer
-Offer customers samples, menu suggestions, and add-ons with a smile
-Uncompromising product quality every single time
-Keep calm and barista on when it gets busy
-Hustle to keep shop looking ‘clean & ready’ at all times (clean bar, clean
towels, no dishes, no crumbs, no clutter, hoppers full, pastries full, tags
displayed)
-Continually stock coffee, paper goods, pastries, retail coffee & chocolate as it’s purchased
-Operate cash register; follow cash handling procedures
-Wash bar equipment and dishes throughout your shift
-Keep shop inviting and clean: inside and out, front and back
-Follow health, safety, and sanitation guidelines with care
-Other duties as assigned
Qualifications
· Minimum 2 years barista or bartending experience required
· Positive personality
· Willingness to pick up shifts, as needed
· Have great communication skills and a professional, friendly attitude
·Retail or client/customer service experience a plus
· Be over 18 in order to work late nights.
Culture
This job is really fun with great co-workers and awesome customers. At times, this job, like any in a growing small business, is also stressful. The shop gets busy and stays busy so keeping your cool even when it’s hot in the shop is critical. Positive stress management attitudes and techniques, while working hard alongside the rest of the team, are a must.
Job Type: Full-time
Salary: $12.50 to $14.00 /hour
Experience:
Barista or Bartending: 2 years (Required)
Customer Service: 1 year (Preferred)

Barista
Dote’s baristas are responsible for delivering on our Company promise to create a welcoming place for the community to relax and connect. This role is responsible for all business execution during their shift including drink making, food service, cash handling, cleaning, display and awesome customer service.
Responsibilities
· Problem solve and use good judgment
· Set an example of top notch service and barista skills every day, including:
-Skilled drink making and coffee QC
-Deliver great service
-Welcome and thank every customer
-Offer customers samples, menu suggestions, and add-ons with a smile
-Uncompromising product quality every single time
-Keep calm and barista on when it gets busy
-Hustle to keep shop looking ‘clean & ready’ at all times (clean bar, clean
towels, no dishes, no crumbs, no clutter, hoppers full, pastries full, tags
displayed)
-Continually stock coffee, paper goods, pastries, retail coffee & chocolate as it’s purchased
-Operate cash register; follow cash handling procedures
-Wash bar equipment and dishes throughout your shift
-Keep shop inviting and clean: inside and out, front and back
-Follow health, safety, and sanitation guidelines with care
-Other duties as assigned
Qualifications
· Minimum 2 years barista or bartending experience required
· Positive personality
· Willingness to pick up shifts, as needed
· Have great communication skills and a professional, friendly attitude
·Retail or client/customer service experience a plus
· Be over 18 in order to work late nights.
Culture
This job is really fun with great co-workers and awesome customers. At times, this job, like any in a growing small business, is also stressful. The shop gets busy and stays busy so keeping your cool even when it’s hot in the shop is critical. Positive stress management attitudes and techniques, while working hard alongside the rest of the team, are a must.

CONCESSIONS

Under the directions of the Keno Manager, the Supervisor oversees the day-to-day operation of the Keno personnel on the shift. The supervisor verifies and approves winnings for payouts. Maintains accountability for the impress bank and is the first line for handling guest disputes. DUTIES: Provides Clearly Superior Customer Service to all internal and external customers. Ensures the operation of the Keno area is efficient and in accordance with department's policies and procedures and the Tribal-State Compact. Ensures compliance with all Class III gaming regulations. Assists the Keno Manager in the development of policy and procedure manuals for Keno operations. Monitors said manuals in an effort to quickly handle disputes and train new personnel. May Assist the manager in developing schedules and various aspects of monitoring employee performance. Keeps management informed relative to customer and employee relations. Rechecks tickets upon request. Responsible for opening and closing games including the completion of required reports. Pays winning tickets. Responsible for cash transaction during assigned shift. QUALIFICATIONS: High School Diploma or GED required.


AL Studio are looking for an energetic, well organized cashier/Customer Service Representative who enjoy be around with children and art to join us as a team! Work location are in Kirkland downtown and Factoria Bellevue; Hours are mostly M-F 3-8:30pm and weekends.
Responsibilities:
Answer emails and making phone calls, about general enrollment , reschedule and follow up.Re-engaging inactive members
Take payments, archive, tracking payments; Input registration document online and stay organized.
Staying updated on promotions: Renew art display twice a month; Seasonal decoration; Seaonal poster and flyers publishing
Liaison between our studios, business vendors and educational institutions.
Help instructors to track students attendance during rush hours. Help manager scheduling staff occasionally.
Clean up and set up for classes/camp/party together with art instructors during rush hours.
As a candidate, we’d like you to have:
Have a strong customer service orientation and be able to communicate effectively with students parents, prospective clients, vendors, and team. Maintain client confidentiality.
Have a high school diploma or equivalent (GED).Possess basic math and cash handling experience. Good at Excel.
Art background or daycare/school working experience is a plus.
Must consent to a nationwide criminal background check.
If you are interested, please send us your resume, cover letter and your expectation of hourly pay rate to info@alstudioart.com

University Book Store is now hiring buyback staff!
Are you a “people-person” who is enthusiastic about providing great customer service? Are you looking for a flexible schedule and/or short term work? Do you enjoy working with students? If so, consider becoming a buyback associate at University Book Store for the upcoming busy season!
What will I be doing?
Providing friendly and efficient customer service at all times, ensuring a pleasant shopping experience for all our customers.
Process buyback and returns transactions on the POS following established procedures.
Re-price and/or re-shelve books.
Utilizing available resources to assist customers in the best way possible.
Performing other tasks as assigned.
What skills/experience do I need?
Demonstrated ability and strong desire to provide high standard of customer service with enthusiasm and energy.
Previous retail and cashiering experience a plus!
Excellent record of attendance and reliability in previous employment.
Excellent communication skills.
Ability to multi-task and work well independently in a high volume sales environment.
Ability to stand for long periods of time and lift up to 30 lbs. on an occasional basis.
What will my schedule look like?
That’s largely up to you! Shifts are available beginning 12/7/19 and go through 1/17/20.
We’re fairly flexible with our seasonal temporary staff and will accommodate your availability as much as we are able. However, in order to be considered for this round of hiring, you must be able to attend a mandatory training session on 12/3, 12/5, or 12/6.
Why should I apply?
In addition to a $15.00/hour wage and a 15% employee discount on days worked, we offer a relaxed work environment with a casual dress code and flexible scheduling. Many of our buyback temps enjoy the experience so much that they come back for most RUSHes!
How do I apply?
Click the “apply” button to fill out an application. Or, join us at one of our job fairs that will be held on the following dates and times at 4326 University Way NE:
November 21st1pm-4pm
November 22nd11am-3pm
November 25th10am-1pm

Yes

Bi weekly or Twice monthly

Maintain an accurate cash drawer, ensuring that all transactions are accounted for by the end of the shift

University Book Store is now hiring cashiers for Holiday and Winter RUSH!
Are you a “people-person” who is enthusiastic about providing great customer service? Are you looking for a flexible schedule and/or short term work? If so, consider becoming a cashier at University Book Store for the Holiday season and Winter RUSH.
What will I be doing?
Providing friendly and efficient customer service at all times, ensuring a pleasant shopping experience for all our customers.
Greeting and engaging customers.
Process transactions on the POS using established procedures.
Utilizing available resources to assist customers in the best way possible.
Performing other tasks as assigned.
What skills/experience do I need?
Demonstrated ability and strong desire to provide high standard of customer service with enthusiasm and energy.
Previous retail and cashiering experience a plus!
Excellent record of attendance and reliability in previous employment.
Excellent communication skills.
Ability to multi-task and work well independently in a high volume sales environment.
Ability to stand for long periods of time and lift up to 30 lbs. on an occasional basis.
What will my schedule look like?
That’s largely up to you! Holiday shifts begin 12/1 and go through Christmas Eve. Winter RUSH begins right after the holidays and go through 1/17/20.
We’re fairly flexible with our seasonal temporary staff and will accommodate your availability as much as we are able. However, in order to be considered for this holiday season, you must be able to attend a mandatory training session on 11/29, 12/6, or 12/9.
Why should I apply?
In addition to a $15.00/hour wage and a 15% employee discount on days worked, we offer a relaxed work environment with a casual dress code and flexible scheduling.

Husky Sales Associate
General Merchandise Full Time, 36 hours/week*
University Book Store is proud to be the largest supplier of officially-licensed Husky gear. We're looking for an upbeat people-person to join our team! This is a fulltime position with a set schedule where you will provide great customer service to our fans.
As a Husky Shop Sales Associate, your typical day might include the following:
Greet and engage customers.
Process sales and return transactions.
Assist customers in finding the merchandise they need.
Keep the sales floor clean and tidy.
Communicate inventory levels, special orders, and merchandise assortment to the Department Manager and Buyers.
Help out other departments within the General Merchandise area as needed.
Perform other duties as needed.
This position might be for you if:
You are enthusiastic about the Huskies and the University of Washington.
You provide friendly, high-quality customer service.
You're an excellent communicator.
You have previous retail and cashiering experience
You're organized and detail-oriented.
You have an excellent attendance record.
Hours
This is a fulltime position with a set schedule of 36 hours per week. Please visit ubookstore.com/jobs to see available schedules.
Wage & Benefits
In accordance with Seattle minimum wage laws, the starting wage for this position is $15.00; once medical benefits are elected, the wage will be adjusted to $13.25. This is a fully benefitted position. Benefits include: medical, dental, and disability insurance; holiday, vacation, and sick pay; 401k retirement plan; merchandise discount; employee assistance program; and a subsidized bus pass.
To Apply
***Apply online at ubookstore.com/jobs. Please note: we are unable to fully consider materials submitted through other avenues such as Indeed.com without a corresponding application through our website.***

We are genuine in our belief that sports make people better and so are you! Immerse yourself in a workplace that loves to be active and lives the brand. Associates joining our team have an opportunity to be a part of the #1 sporting goods retailer in the country and create a lasting impact on their communities through sport and activity.
On our Team, everyone plays a critical role. Your Mission (and Ours) is to serve and inspire athletes and outdoor enthusiasts to achieve their personal best through the relentless improvement of everything we do. Sales Associate Duties:
Create a world-class customer experience by providing passionate customer service and selling through customer engagement, specifically (but not limited to) the Golf Department
Uphold company standards for merchandise presentation of the best apparel and equipment brands in sporting goods
Demonstrate ability to genuinely interact with customers to show passion, knowledge, dedication, and commitment in their sport or activity
Promote company programs including warranty sales, Scorecard (loyalty program), private-label credit cards, and other seasonal promotions
As business needs arise, other tasks may become necessary
Qualifications
Success Profile:
Flexible availability – including nights, weekend, and holidays
1-2 years of Retail Cashier, Retail Sales, or cash-handling experience preferred
Passion for Golf Click HERE to review our Rewards & Benefits Information DICK’S Sporting Goods is an Equal Opportunity Employer.


Duties
Summary
The primary function of this position is to perform hostess/cashiering tasks. Incumbent greets guests, escorts them to table, alerting server that table has been seated.
Responsibilities
The primary function of this position is to perform hostess/cashiering tasks. Incumbent greets guests, escorts them to table, alerting server that table has been seated. Coordinate activities involved in setting up for parties/catered events. May make table reservations for patrons as appropriate. Incumbent responsibilities include preparation of menu boards, secure supplies, etc. for operation of facility. Ensures adequate change fund is on hand; takes food and drink orders from patrons. Assist in maintaining good order and discipline. Answer patron’s questions in pleasant, courteous manner. Ensure proper preparation, display and price marking of items and adherence to correct receipt and pricing procedures. Maintains sales records and inventory on daily basis. Follow procedure for safeguarding cash. Ensure compliance with fire, safety, sanitation and security regulations. Incumbent will perform some housekeeping duties, including washing dishes, sweeping floors, wiping down tables and taking out trash. Rings sales and/or ticket sales by individual items, totals the sales, receives money, and makes change. Incumbent is responsible for turning in receipts at the end of each shift. Monitors operation of assigned area of responsibility, periodically checking to identify and resolve problems which may arise. Enforce rules. Handle all phone inquiries. Incumbent ensures customer satisfaction. Perform other duties as assigned.
Travel Required
Not required
Supervisory status
No
Promotion Potential
02
Job family (Series)
2091 Sales Store Clerical
Requirements
Requirements
Conditions of Employment
: Incumbent required attendance of sanitation training course to obtain a valid health card.
Offer of employment contingent upon successful completion of National Agency Check (NACI) background check.
Availability to include work on evenings, weekend and holidays may be required.
Qualifications
Must have working knowledge of cash register operation and sales. Must be neat in appearance with ability to work with the public. Employee must complete operational duties with accuracy and efficiency to ensure smooth operation of the business and patron satisfaction. Work is primarily standing; however, some walking, carrying and light lifting (15-25 lbs.) is occasionally required in support of special events and functions.
Education
Additional information
Some positions have special requirements. Selectee may be required to complete a one (1) year probationary period. Participation in Direct Deposit/Electronic Fund Transfer within the first 30 days of employment is required. We utilize E-Verify to confirm selectee’s eligibility to work in the United States. Salary is dependent on experience and/or education.
DON is an Equal Employment Opportunity Employer. All qualified candidates will receive consideration without regard to race, color, national origin, religion, sex, age, mental or physical disability, genetic information, reprisal, marital status, political affiliation, sexual orientation, or any other non-merit factor. The DON provides reasonable accommodations to applicants with disabilities. How You Will Be Evaluated
You will be evaluated for this job based on how well you meet the qualifications above.
All resumes will be reviewed to determine if they meet the hiring eligibility and qualification requirements listed in this announcement, and will be rated based on the information provided in the resume to determine the level of KSAs related to the job requirements. Using the qualifications of the position, a predetermined rating criterion of KSAs will be used for each resume. Best qualified applicants will be referred to the hiring manager. SUMMARY: Provides guest service by properly seating guests at their tables, cleans dining areas and assists Food and Beverage staff as needed. DUTIES: Sees to all the needs of the dining guests by providing clearly superior customer service. Ability to learn and follow the room rotation system for seating guests. Assists in keeping the host/hostess area clean and organized. Actively practices the customer service standards. Assists co workers with rolling silverware and other assigned side work duties. Greets guests and answers questions. Makes all cash transactions, gives change and cash out till. Assist guests with comps and food specials Coupons, two-for-one etc. Assists with reservations. QUALIFICATIONS: High School Diploma or GED. Some food preparation training is helpful. Food Handlers Card required. One 1 year of experience in Food and Beverage industry.

Oversees the operation of the Slot Department during assigned shift. Ensures good quality customer service to Cage/Slots Department. Handles cash transactions and provides Clearly Supervisor Customer Service to guests. DUTIES: Responsible for ensuring the opening and closing of games, including completion of all required reports. Responsible for scheduling staff, handling employee disputes and training new employees. Responsible for signing in and out necessary keys for assigned shift. Providing assistance to new customers on game rules and operation of machines. Performs all duties in accordance with Clearly Superior Customer Service standards. Maintain custody of the Cashier's inventory of currency, coins, tokens, forms, documents and records transactions accurately at cashier's station or as Floor Attendant. Performs cash transactions and provides floor support as necessary. Cashes out jackpots under the direct supervision of the Shift Manager. Effectively, efficiently and professionally communicates with coworkers using a radio. Perfoms basic troubleshooting on Player Terminals. QUALIFICATIONS: High School diploma or GED. Retail or customer service experience required. A minimum of 2 yrs. gaming experience or supervisory experience required. A minimum of 2 yrs. large volume cash handling experience is preferred coupled with a fast-paced business environment.


SUMMARY: Provides service to guests i.e. taking food orders for deli, espresso, making change, and answering questions concerning casino food and entertainment. DUTIES: Greets guests and answers questions. Processes all food rebenue transactions for the Deli and satellite areas. Ability to be cross trained to work in the satellite areas. Provides food service and make sales to gaming floor guests using the food cart. Assists guests with comps and food specials. Stocks the condiments and maintains the deli beverage stattions. Maintains the cleanliness of the deli dining and counter areas. QUALIFICATIONS: Must be 16 years of age and enrolled in high school or hold a high school diploma or GED. Cashiers selling food on the gaming floor must be at least 18 years og age. 1 years of cash or customer service related experience, preferred.


The Cook's Helper provides support services for cafeteria, production, and or patient care areas. Positions include but are not limited to grill, cashier, deli, salad bar, nutrition services aid, pantry aide, and catering. Responsibilities include, but not limited to: 1. Preparation and serving of sufficient hot and cold food for patients, cafeteria and catering and/or mini deli areas. 2. Replenishing food and supplies in cafeteria, catering and/or patient food service areas. 3. Setting up catered functions and delivering coffee. 4. Cashing and keeping cash records. 5. Setting up, opening, and closing of cafeteria and/or mini deli. 6. Delivering and picking up tray carts on nursing units. 7. Delivering patient menus.
REQUIRED for the position:
High school graduate or equivalent combination of education and experience
A valid Washington State "Food and Beverage Workers" Permit
Knowledge of safety, sanitation and food-handling standards and practices.
1 year of recent food service and cashiering work experience OR any combination of experience and education that would demonstrate the capability to perform the duties
Must be able to effectively communicate with customers, fellow employees and other departments.
Ability to establish and maintain effective working relationships.
Ability to multi task in a fast paced, constantly changing environment
Capable of efficient time management.
Ability to provide excellent customer service.
Basic math skills (addition, subtraction, multiplication, division) for cash handling purposes.
Basic understanding of POS functionality.
This position is covered by a collective bargaining agreement between EvergreenHealth and the Service Employees International Union (SEIU) Healthcare 1199NW. Union membershp is optional.

Under the directions of the Keno Manager, the Supervisor oversees the day-to-day operation of the Keno personnel on the shift. The supervisor verifies and approves winnings for payouts. Maintains accountability for the impress bank and is the first line for handling guest disputes. DUTIES: Provides Clearly Superior Customer Service to all internal and external customers. Ensures the operation of the Keno area is efficient and in accordance with department's policies and procedures and the Tribal-State Compact. Ensures compliance with all Class III gaming regulations. Assists the Keno Manager in the development of policy and procedure manuals for Keno operations. Monitors said manuals in an effort to quickly handle disputes and train new personnel. May Assist the manager in developing schedules and various aspects of monitoring employee performance. Keeps management informed relative to customer and employee relations. Rechecks tickets upon request. Responsible for opening and closing games including the completion of required reports. Pays winning tickets. Responsible for cash transaction during assigned shift. QUALIFICATIONS: High School Diploma or GED required.

USHER
Cinemark Ushers provide movie and theatre information while ensuring a quality listening and viewing experience for all guests.
BOX OFFICE/CASHIER
Box Office Attendants sell tickets while providing movie and event information. They enforce film studio and theatre admission policies. This individual will clean and maintain the box office area. They are responsible for security of cash and tickets.
CONCESSIONS
Concessionists sell soft drinks, packaged and/or bulk candies, popcorn, hot dogs, ice cream, coffee, and other food items to theatre patrons. They also, maintain, stock, and clean the concession stand and/or restaurant.

You also get to enjoy benefits like competitive pay packages, lucrative bonus opportunities, fantastic employee discounts, flexible schedules, continuous hands-on training and learning programs. High school graduate or equivalent combination of education and experience

Knowledge of safety, sanitation and food-handling standards and practices.
1 year of recent food service and cashiering work experience OR any combination of experience and education that would demonstrate the capability to perform the duties
Must be able to effectively communicate with customers, fellow employees and other departments.
Ability to establish and maintain effective working relationships.
Ability to multi task in a fast paced, constantly changing environment
Capable of efficient time management.
Ability to provide excellent customer service.
Basic math skills (addition, subtraction, multiplication, division) for cash handling purposes.
Basic understanding of POS functionality. This position is covered by a collective bargaining agreement between EvergreenHealth and the Service Employees International Union (SEIU) Healthcare 1199NW. Union membershp is optional. Location: Evergreen Healthcare · Food and Nutrition Services
Schedule: Per Diem, Varies, per diem


Under the directions of the Keno Manager, the Supervisor oversees the day-to-day operation of the Keno personnel on the shift. The supervisor verifies and approves winnings for payouts. Maintains accountability for the impress bank and is the first line for handling guest disputes. DUTIES: Provides Clearly Superior Customer Service to all internal and external customers. Ensures the operation of the Keno area is efficient and in accordance with department's policies and procedures and the Tribal-State Compact. Ensures compliance with all Class III gaming regulations. Assists the Keno Manager in the development of policy and procedure manuals for Keno operations. Monitors said manuals in an effort to quickly handle disputes and train new personnel. May Assist the manager in developing schedules and various aspects of monitoring employee performance. Keeps management informed relative to customer and employee relations. Rechecks tickets upon request. Responsible for opening and closing games including the completion of required reports. Pays winning tickets. Responsible for cash transaction during assigned shift. QUALIFICATIONS: High School Diploma or GED required.

Barista
Dote’s baristas are responsible for delivering on our Company promise to create a welcoming place for the community to relax and connect. This role is responsible for all business execution during their shift including drink making, food service, cash handling, cleaning, display and awesome customer service.
Responsibilities
· Problem solve and use good judgment
· Set an example of top notch service and barista skills every day, including:
-Skilled drink making and coffee QC
-Deliver great service
-Welcome and thank every customer
-Offer customers samples, menu suggestions, and add-ons with a smile
-Uncompromising product quality every single time
-Keep calm and barista on when it gets busy
-Hustle to keep shop looking ‘clean & ready’ at all times (clean bar, clean
towels, no dishes, no crumbs, no clutter, hoppers full, pastries full, tags
displayed)
-Continually stock coffee, paper goods, pastries, retail coffee & chocolate as it’s purchased
-Operate cash register; follow cash handling procedures
-Wash bar equipment and dishes throughout your shift
-Keep shop inviting and clean: inside and out, front and back
-Follow health, safety, and sanitation guidelines with care
-Other duties as assigned
Qualifications
· Minimum 2 years barista or bartending experience required
· Positive personality
· Willingness to pick up shifts, as needed
· Have great communication skills and a professional, friendly attitude
·Retail or client/customer service experience a plus
· Be over 18 in order to work late nights.
Culture
This job is really fun with great co-workers and awesome customers. At times, this job, like any in a growing small business, is also stressful. The shop gets busy and stays busy so keeping your cool even when it’s hot in the shop is critical. Positive stress management attitudes and techniques, while working hard alongside the rest of the team, are a must.
Job Type: Full-time
Salary: $12.50 to $14.00 /hour
Experience:
Barista or Bartending: 2 years (Required)
Customer Service: 1 year (Preferred)
Additional Compensation:
Tips
Work Location:
One location
Tip income:
Yes
Schedule:
Monday to Friday
Weekends required
Day shift
Night shift
8 hour shift

Responsible for scheduling staff, handling employee disputes and training new employees. Responsible for signing in and out necessary keys for assigned shift. Providing assistance to new customers on game rules and operation of machines. Performs all duties in accordance with Clearly Superior Customer Service standards. Maintain custody of the Cashier's inventory of currency, coins, tokens, forms, documents and records transactions accurately at cashier's station or as Floor Attendant. Performs cash transactions and provides floor support as necessary. Cashes out jackpots under the direct supervision of the Shift Manager. Effectively, efficiently and professionally communicates with coworkers using a radio. Perfoms basic troubleshooting on Player Terminals. QUALIFICATIONS: High School diploma or GED. A minimum of 2 yrs. large volume cash handling experience is preferred coupled with a fast-paced business environment.

$12.50 Per Hour About Wilco
Dating back to the early 1930’s, Wilco, a growing retailer, has stood the test of time by maintaining focus on our values and never losing our passion for customer service. Wilco is progressive, and unlike the standard “farm store”. With a variety of departments including Garden, Pet and Animal Supply, Hardware and Paint, Clothing, and Pet Grooming (that’s right, Pet Grooming), partnered with personalized service, our customers consider Wilco a preferred retail destination.
Wilco has been named as one of the Top Work Places in Oregon and SW Washington by the Oregonian in 2012, 2013, 2014, 2015, 2016, 2017 and 2018. We are dedicated to our team, and attribute this distinction to them. Wilco is an equal opportunity employer.

Duties
Summary
The primary function of this position is to perform hostess/cashiering tasks. Incumbent greets guests, escorts them to table, alerting server that table has been seated.
Responsibilities
The primary function of this position is to perform hostess/cashiering tasks. Incumbent greets guests, escorts them to table, alerting server that table has been seated. Coordinate activities involved in setting up for parties/catered events. May make table reservations for patrons as appropriate. Incumbent responsibilities include preparation of menu boards, secure supplies, etc. for operation of facility. Ensures adequate change fund is on hand; takes food and drink orders from patrons. Assist in maintaining good order and discipline. Answer patron’s questions in pleasant, courteous manner. Ensure proper preparation, display and price marking of items and adherence to correct receipt and pricing procedures. Maintains sales records and inventory on daily basis. Follow procedure for safeguarding cash. Ensure compliance with fire, safety, sanitation and security regulations. Incumbent will perform some housekeeping duties, including washing dishes, sweeping floors, wiping down tables and taking out trash. Rings sales and/or ticket sales by individual items, totals the sales, receives money, and makes change. Incumbent is responsible for turning in receipts at the end of each shift. Monitors operation of assigned area of responsibility, periodically checking to identify and resolve problems which may arise. Enforce rules. Handle all phone inquiries. Incumbent ensures customer satisfaction. Perform other duties as assigned.
Travel Required
Not required
Supervisory status
No
Promotion Potential
02
Job family (Series)
2091 Sales Store Clerical
Requirements
Requirements
Conditions of Employment
: Incumbent required attendance of sanitation training course to obtain a valid health card.
Offer of employment contingent upon successful completion of National Agency Check (NACI) background check.
Availability to include work on evenings, weekend and holidays may be required.
Qualifications
Must have working knowledge of cash register operation and sales. Must be neat in appearance with ability to work with the public. Employee must complete operational duties with accuracy and efficiency to ensure smooth operation of the business and patron satisfaction. Work is primarily standing; however, some walking, carrying and light lifting (15-25 lbs.) is occasionally required in support of special events and functions.
Education

Barista
Dote’s baristas are responsible for delivering on our Company promise to create a welcoming place for the community to relax and connect. This role is responsible for all business execution during their shift including drink making, food service, cash handling, cleaning, display and awesome customer service.
Responsibilities
· Problem solve and use good judgment
· Set an example of top notch service and barista skills every day, including:
-Skilled drink making and coffee QC
-Deliver great service
-Welcome and thank every customer
-Offer customers samples, menu suggestions, and add-ons with a smile
-Uncompromising product quality every single time
-Keep calm and barista on when it gets busy
-Hustle to keep shop looking ‘clean & ready’ at all times (clean bar, clean
towels, no dishes, no crumbs, no clutter, hoppers full, pastries full, tags
displayed)
-Continually stock coffee, paper goods, pastries, retail coffee & chocolate as it’s purchased
-Operate cash register; follow cash handling procedures
-Wash bar equipment and dishes throughout your shift
-Keep shop inviting and clean: inside and out, front and back
-Follow health, safety, and sanitation guidelines with care
-Other duties as assigned
Qualifications
· Minimum 2 years barista or bartending experience required
· Positive personality
· Willingness to pick up shifts, as needed
· Have great communication skills and a professional, friendly attitude
·Retail or client/customer service experience a plus
· Be over 18 in order to work late nights.
Culture
This job is really fun with great co-workers and awesome customers. At times, this job, like any in a growing small business, is also stressful. The shop gets busy and stays busy so keeping your cool even when it’s hot in the shop is critical. Positive stress management attitudes and techniques, while working hard alongside the rest of the team, are a must.

The Cook's Helper provides support services for cafeteria, production, and or patient care areas. Positions include but are not limited to grill, cashier, deli, salad bar, nutrition services aid, pantry aide, and catering. Responsibilities include, but not limited to: 1. Preparation and serving of sufficient hot and cold food for patients, cafeteria and catering and/or mini deli areas. 2. Replenishing food and supplies in cafeteria, catering and/or patient food service areas. 3. Setting up catered functions and delivering coffee. 4. Cashing and keeping cash records. 5. Setting up, opening, and closing of cafeteria and/or mini deli. 6. Delivering and picking up tray carts on nursing units. 7. Delivering patient menus.
REQUIRED for the position:
High school graduate or equivalent combination of education and experience
A valid Washington State "Food and Beverage Workers" Permit
Knowledge of safety, sanitation and food-handling standards and practices.
1 year of recent food service and cashiering work experience OR any combination of experience and education that would demonstrate the capability to perform the duties
Must be able to effectively communicate with customers, fellow employees and other departments.
Ability to establish and maintain effective working relationships.
Ability to multi task in a fast paced, constantly changing environment
Capable of efficient time management.
Ability to provide excellent customer service.
Basic math skills (addition, subtraction, multiplication, division) for cash handling purposes.
Basic understanding of POS functionality.
This position is covered by a collective bargaining agreement between EvergreenHealth and the Service Employees International Union (SEIU) Healthcare 1199NW. Union membershp is optional.

Responsible for scheduling staff, handling employee disputes and training new employees. Responsible for signing in and out necessary keys for assigned shift. Providing assistance to new customers on game rules and operation of machines. Performs all duties in accordance with Clearly Superior Customer Service standards. Maintain custody of the Cashier's inventory of currency, coins, tokens, forms, documents and records transactions accurately at cashier's station or as Floor Attendant. Performs cash transactions and provides floor support as necessary. Cashes out jackpots under the direct supervision of the Shift Manager. Effectively, efficiently and professionally communicates with coworkers using a radio. Perfoms basic troubleshooting on Player Terminals. QUALIFICATIONS: High School diploma or GED. Duties
Summary
The primary function of this position is to perform hostess/cashiering tasks. Incumbent greets guests, escorts them to table, alerting server that table has been seated.
Responsibilities
The primary function of this position is to perform hostess/cashiering tasks. Incumbent greets guests, escorts them to table, alerting server that table has been seated. Coordinate activities involved in setting up for parties/catered events. May make table reservations for patrons as appropriate. Incumbent responsibilities include preparation of menu boards, secure supplies, etc. for operation of facility. Ensures adequate change fund is on hand; takes food and drink orders from patrons. Assist in maintaining good order and discipline. Answer patron’s questions in pleasant, courteous manner. Ensure proper preparation, display and price marking of items and adherence to correct receipt and pricing procedures. Maintains sales records and inventory on daily basis. Follow procedure for safeguarding cash. Ensure compliance with fire, safety, sanitation and security regulations. Incumbent will perform some housekeeping duties, including washing dishes, sweeping floors, wiping down tables and taking out trash. Rings sales and/or ticket sales by individual items, totals the sales, receives money, and makes change. Incumbent is responsible for turning in receipts at the end of each shift. Monitors operation of assigned area of responsibility, periodically checking to identify and resolve problems which may arise. Enforce rules. Handle all phone inquiries. Incumbent ensures customer satisfaction. Perform other duties as assigned.

Not required

No

Employee must complete operational duties with accuracy and efficiency to ensure smooth operation of the business and patron satisfaction. Work is primarily standing; however, some walking, carrying and light lifting (15-25 lbs.) is occasionally required in support of special events and functions.
