SUMMARY: Provides guest service by properly seating guests at their tables, cleans dining areas and assists Food and Beverage staff as needed. DUTIES: Sees to all the needs of the dining guests by providing clearly superior customer service. Ability to learn and follow the room rotation system for seating guests. Assists in keeping the host/hostess area clean and organized. Actively practices the customer service standards. Assists co workers with rolling silverware and other assigned side work duties. Greets guests and answers questions. Makes all cash transactions, gives change and cash out till. Assist guests with comps and food specials Coupons, two-for-one etc. Assists with reservations. QUALIFICATIONS: High School Diploma or GED. Some food preparation training is helpful. Food Handlers Card required. One 1 year of experience in Food and Beverage industry.


Oversees the operation of the Slot Department during assigned shift. Ensures good quality customer service to Cage/Slots Department. Handles cash transactions and provides Clearly Supervisor Customer Service to guests. DUTIES: Responsible for ensuring the opening and closing of games, including completion of all required reports. Responsible for scheduling staff, handling employee disputes and training new employees. Responsible for signing in and out necessary keys for assigned shift. Providing assistance to new customers on game rules and operation of machines. Performs all duties in accordance with Clearly Superior Customer Service standards. Maintain custody of the Cashier's inventory of currency, coins, tokens, forms, documents and records transactions accurately at cashier's station or as Floor Attendant. Performs cash transactions and provides floor support as necessary. Cashes out jackpots under the direct supervision of the Shift Manager. Effectively, efficiently and professionally communicates with coworkers using a radio. Perfoms basic troubleshooting on Player Terminals. QUALIFICATIONS: High School diploma or GED. Retail or customer service experience required. A minimum of 2 yrs. gaming experience or supervisory experience required. A minimum of 2 yrs. large volume cash handling experience is preferred coupled with a fast-paced business environment.

DUTIES: Greets guests and answers questions. Processes all food rebenue transactions for the Deli and satellite areas. Ability to be cross trained to work in the satellite areas. Provides food service and make sales to gaming floor guests using the food cart. Assists guests with comps and food specials. Stocks the condiments and maintains the deli beverage stattions. Maintains the cleanliness of the deli dining and counter areas. QUALIFICATIONS: Must be 16 years of age and enrolled in high school or hold a high school diploma or GED. Under the directions of the Keno Manager, the Supervisor oversees the day-to-day operation of the Keno personnel on the shift. The supervisor verifies and approves winnings for payouts. Maintains accountability for the impress bank and is the first line for handling guest disputes. DUTIES: Provides Clearly Superior Customer Service to all internal and external customers. Ensures the operation of the Keno area is efficient and in accordance with department's policies and procedures and the Tribal-State Compact. Ensures compliance with all Class III gaming regulations. Assists the Keno Manager in the development of policy and procedure manuals for Keno operations. Monitors said manuals in an effort to quickly handle disputes and train new personnel. May Assist the manager in developing schedules and various aspects of monitoring employee performance. Keeps management informed relative to customer and employee relations. Rechecks tickets upon request. Responsible for opening and closing games including the completion of required reports. Pays winning tickets. Responsible for cash transaction during assigned shift. QUALIFICATIONS: High School Diploma or GED required.


Duties
Summary
The primary function of this position is to perform hostess/cashiering tasks. Incumbent greets guests, escorts them to table, alerting server that table has been seated.
Responsibilities
The primary function of this position is to perform hostess/cashiering tasks. Incumbent greets guests, escorts them to table, alerting server that table has been seated. Coordinate activities involved in setting up for parties/catered events. May make table reservations for patrons as appropriate. Incumbent responsibilities include preparation of menu boards, secure supplies, etc. for operation of facility. Ensures adequate change fund is on hand; takes food and drink orders from patrons. Assist in maintaining good order and discipline. Answer patron’s questions in pleasant, courteous manner. Ensure proper preparation, display and price marking of items and adherence to correct receipt and pricing procedures. Maintains sales records and inventory on daily basis. Follow procedure for safeguarding cash. Ensure compliance with fire, safety, sanitation and security regulations. Incumbent will perform some housekeeping duties, including washing dishes, sweeping floors, wiping down tables and taking out trash. Rings sales and/or ticket sales by individual items, totals the sales, receives money, and makes change. Incumbent is responsible for turning in receipts at the end of each shift. Monitors operation of assigned area of responsibility, periodically checking to identify and resolve problems which may arise. Enforce rules. Handle all phone inquiries. Incumbent ensures customer satisfaction. Perform other duties as assigned.
Travel Required
Not required
Supervisory status
No
Promotion Potential
02
Job family (Series)
2091 Sales Store Clerical
Requirements
Requirements
Conditions of Employment
: Incumbent required attendance of sanitation training course to obtain a valid health card.
Offer of employment contingent upon successful completion of National Agency Check (NACI) background check.
Availability to include work on evenings, weekend and holidays may be required.
Qualifications
Must have working knowledge of cash register operation and sales. Must be neat in appearance with ability to work with the public. Employee must complete operational duties with accuracy and efficiency to ensure smooth operation of the business and patron satisfaction. Work is primarily standing; however, some walking, carrying and light lifting (15-25 lbs.) is occasionally required in support of special events and functions.
Education

Salary is dependent on experience and/or education.

Barista
Dote’s baristas are responsible for delivering on our Company promise to create a welcoming place for the community to relax and connect. This role is responsible for all business execution during their shift including drink making, food service, cash handling, cleaning, display and awesome customer service.
Responsibilities
· Problem solve and use good judgment
· Set an example of top notch service and barista skills every day, including:
-Skilled drink making and coffee QC
-Deliver great service
-Welcome and thank every customer
-Offer customers samples, menu suggestions, and add-ons with a smile
-Uncompromising product quality every single time
-Keep calm and barista on when it gets busy
-Hustle to keep shop looking ‘clean & ready’ at all times (clean bar, clean
towels, no dishes, no crumbs, no clutter, hoppers full, pastries full, tags
displayed)
-Continually stock coffee, paper goods, pastries, retail coffee & chocolate as it’s purchased
-Operate cash register; follow cash handling procedures
-Wash bar equipment and dishes throughout your shift
-Keep shop inviting and clean: inside and out, front and back
-Follow health, safety, and sanitation guidelines with care
-Other duties as assigned
Qualifications
· Minimum 2 years barista or bartending experience required
· Positive personality
· Willingness to pick up shifts, as needed
· Have great communication skills and a professional, friendly attitude
·Retail or client/customer service experience a plus
· Be over 18 in order to work late nights.
Culture
This job is really fun with great co-workers and awesome customers. At times, this job, like any in a growing small business, is also stressful. The shop gets busy and stays busy so keeping your cool even when it’s hot in the shop is critical. Positive stress management attitudes and techniques, while working hard alongside the rest of the team, are a must.
Job Type: Full-time
Salary: $12.50 to $14.00 /hour
Experience:
Barista or Bartending: 2 years (Required)
Customer Service: 1 year (Preferred)
Additional Compensation:
Tips
Work Location:
One location
Tip income:
Yes
Schedule:
Monday to Friday
Weekends required
Day shift
Night shift
8 hour shift

Keep the customer experience quick, easy and fun while helping customers uncover the great deals they're looking for
Create a smooth fitting room experience by greeting customers and taking them to their fitting rooms, then sorting and returning clothing to the floor
Share your love of fashion and tell customers all about upcoming events, our Nordstrom gift cards, Nordstrom RewardsTM program and mailing list
Keep the stockrooms organized and complete all inventory processes, making sure merchandise is properly checked in and accurately ticketed
Work with the team to ensure the sale’s floor stays "runway ready" through re-merchandising and straightening throughout the day
You own this if you have…
Enthusiasm and a sense of adventure, see the glass as half full
Accountability, initiative and a high level of ownership

SUMMARY: Provides service to guests i.e. taking food orders for deli, espresso, making change, and answering questions concerning casino food and entertainment. DUTIES: Greets guests and answers questions. Processes all food rebenue transactions for the Deli and satellite areas. Ability to be cross trained to work in the satellite areas. Provides food service and make sales to gaming floor guests using the food cart. Assists guests with comps and food specials. Stocks the condiments and maintains the deli beverage stattions. Maintains the cleanliness of the deli dining and counter areas. QUALIFICATIONS: Must be 16 years of age and enrolled in high school or hold a high school diploma or GED. What You Will Do
All Lowe’s associates deliver quality customer service while maintaining a store that is clean, safe, and stocked with the products customers need. As a Customer Service Associate – Front End, this means:
Delivering a checkout experience that is quick, professional, and friendly.
Ensuring merchandise is accurately accounted, scanned, and meets the needs of customers.
Engaging in safe work practices and encouraging others to do the same.
The Customer Service Associate – Front End is responsible for delivering excellent customer service during the checkout process. This associate is one of the last interactions with our customer before leaving the store and needs to ensure the customer is satisfied and encouraged to come back to Lowe’s. Therefore, engaging with customers as well as attention to detail are extremely important in this role.
Travel Requirements: This role does not require regular travel; however, this role may need to travel on occasion to meetings, trainings, or to support neighboring stores. What We're Looking For
Hourly Full Time or Part Time: Generally scheduled 39 to 40 or up to 25 hours per week, respectively; more hours may be required based on the needs of the store.
Requires morning, afternoon and evening availability any day of the week.
Physical ability to perform tasks that may require prolonged standing, sitting, and other activities necessary to perform job duties.
Minimally must be able to lift 10 pounds without assistance; may lift over 10 pounds with or without assistance. What You Need To Succeed
Minimum Qualifications
6 months experience using a computer, including inputting, accessing, modifying, or outputting information.
6 months experience using a handheld device (e.g., mobile phone, LRT gun, palm pilot, tablet, iPod) to enter, access, and output information. Preferred Qualifications
6 months experience identifying and selling products based on customer needs, including credit cards, installations, add-on sales, and explaining warranties, product features, and benefits.
6 months retail experience.
6 months experience as a cashier.
If the state or local municipality requires a salesperson license for this position, you must either be licensed or pass the requisite licensing exam within sixty (60) days of starting employment in this position. Lowe’s is an equal opportunity affirmative action employer and administers all personnel practices without regard to race, color, religion, sex, age, national origin, disability, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, marital status, veteran status, genetics or any other category protected under applicable law.


Job Summary
This is a part-time position.
Provide excellent customer service, create invoices and sell farm store products. Handle cash and point of sale (register) procedures accurately and keep checkout and other assigned areas clean and orderly. Assist customers find the appropriate store specialist when needed and provide support on the sales-floor. Assist the Lead Cashier in reaching store goals and participate in general cleaning and maintenance of the retail facility. Responsibilities
Greet customers and assist in matching their need with the relevant person or department.
Check out customers pleasantly and accurately using established standards.
Maintain orderly, secure and correct invoices and cash at assigned station.
Maintain a clean, orderly check out area. Keep adequate inventories of bags, blank invoices and other materials at checkouts.
Pleasantly answer telephones and answer customer inquiries. Successful Candidates Will Have
Customer service, cashier, or related experience.
The ability to operate a computer and point of sale (register).
The ability to perform arithmetic calculations and provide change to customers.
The ability to communicate successfully with customers and co-workers.

$12.50 Per Hour About Wilco
Dating back to the early 1930’s, Wilco, a growing retailer, has stood the test of time by maintaining focus on our values and never losing our passion for customer service. Wilco is progressive, and unlike the standard “farm store”. With a variety of departments including Garden, Pet and Animal Supply, Hardware and Paint, Clothing, and Pet Grooming (that’s right, Pet Grooming), partnered with personalized service, our customers consider Wilco a preferred retail destination.
Wilco has been named as one of the Top Work Places in Oregon and SW Washington by the Oregonian in 2012, 2013, 2014, 2015, 2016, 2017 and 2018. We are dedicated to our team, and attribute this distinction to them. Wilco is an equal opportunity employer.

Under the directions of the Keno Manager, the Supervisor oversees the day-to-day operation of the Keno personnel on the shift. The supervisor verifies and approves winnings for payouts. Maintains accountability for the impress bank and is the first line for handling guest disputes. DUTIES: Provides Clearly Superior Customer Service to all internal and external customers. Ensures the operation of the Keno area is efficient and in accordance with department's policies and procedures and the Tribal-State Compact. Ensures compliance with all Class III gaming regulations. Assists the Keno Manager in the development of policy and procedure manuals for Keno operations. Monitors said manuals in an effort to quickly handle disputes and train new personnel. May Assist the manager in developing schedules and various aspects of monitoring employee performance. Keeps management informed relative to customer and employee relations. Rechecks tickets upon request. Responsible for opening and closing games including the completion of required reports. Pays winning tickets. Responsible for cash transaction during assigned shift. QUALIFICATIONS: High School Diploma or GED required.


Oversees the operation of the Slot Department during assigned shift. Ensures good quality customer service to Cage/Slots Department. Handles cash transactions and provides Clearly Supervisor Customer Service to guests. DUTIES: Responsible for ensuring the opening and closing of games, including completion of all required reports. Responsible for scheduling staff, handling employee disputes and training new employees. Responsible for signing in and out necessary keys for assigned shift. Providing assistance to new customers on game rules and operation of machines. Performs all duties in accordance with Clearly Superior Customer Service standards. Maintain custody of the Cashier's inventory of currency, coins, tokens, forms, documents and records transactions accurately at cashier's station or as Floor Attendant. Performs cash transactions and provides floor support as necessary. Cashes out jackpots under the direct supervision of the Shift Manager. Effectively, efficiently and professionally communicates with coworkers using a radio. Perfoms basic troubleshooting on Player Terminals. QUALIFICATIONS: High School diploma or GED. Retail or customer service experience required. A minimum of 2 yrs. gaming experience or supervisory experience required. A minimum of 2 yrs. large volume cash handling experience is preferred coupled with a fast-paced business environment.

Barista
Dote’s baristas are responsible for delivering on our Company promise to create a welcoming place for the community to relax and connect. This role is responsible for all business execution during their shift including drink making, food service, cash handling, cleaning, display and awesome customer service.
Responsibilities
· Problem solve and use good judgment
· Set an example of top notch service and barista skills every day, including:
-Skilled drink making and coffee QC
-Deliver great service
-Welcome and thank every customer
-Offer customers samples, menu suggestions, and add-ons with a smile
-Uncompromising product quality every single time
-Keep calm and barista on when it gets busy
-Hustle to keep shop looking ‘clean & ready’ at all times (clean bar, clean
towels, no dishes, no crumbs, no clutter, hoppers full, pastries full, tags
displayed)
-Continually stock coffee, paper goods, pastries, retail coffee & chocolate as it’s purchased
-Operate cash register; follow cash handling procedures
-Wash bar equipment and dishes throughout your shift
-Keep shop inviting and clean: inside and out, front and back
-Follow health, safety, and sanitation guidelines with care
-Other duties as assigned
Qualifications
· Minimum 2 years barista or bartending experience required
· Positive personality
· Willingness to pick up shifts, as needed
· Have great communication skills and a professional, friendly attitude
·Retail or client/customer service experience a plus
· Be over 18 in order to work late nights.
Culture
This job is really fun with great co-workers and awesome customers. At times, this job, like any in a growing small business, is also stressful. The shop gets busy and stays busy so keeping your cool even when it’s hot in the shop is critical. Positive stress management attitudes and techniques, while working hard alongside the rest of the team, are a must.

As the nation’s indoor electric karting leader and innovator for over the past decade, K1 Speed does not compromise on the quality and value of the product we offer. Through our industrial go-karts and excellent staff, our passion is to show the world how fun karting can actually be. As a Front Desk Cashier , you will exude all the qualities that K1 embraces: positivity, cheerfulness, and exceptional customer service. Is this you?

Join the Tutta Bella Crew at our new counter concept in Kirkland Urban. We are bringing our traditional wood fired pizzas that made us Northwest famous and adding some delicious grab and go items to our new location inside the next generation Kirkland Urban QFC - right next to their Q20 brew pub.
Tutta Bella Crew members work at our counter service concepts either demonstrating the pizzaiolo skills to slap and open the dough, top the pizzas and cook them in our Italian wood fired ovens or performing the customer facing skills necessary to provide our guests with a memorable experience and helping with cutting pizzas, etc... or ideally, both. In addition to our Neapolitan pizzas, the Tutta Bella Crew will be providing guests with Italian sandwiches, lasagna, salads, tiramisu and fresh Sicilian cannoli from our counter service location. Ultimately Tutta Bella Crew members are responsible for executing our purpose of “Nourishing lives by sharing traditions, authentic food and love,” and providing a memorable guest experience to every guest. The way we accomplish this is through our adherence to Neapolitan traditions, following our proven recipes and systems, showing genuine care for our guests and teammates, and enjoying making people happy. Benefits:
Friendly, supportive work environments
Advancement in a growing company (if you want it)
Competitive compensation & benefits
Training in scratch cooking & centuries-old culinary traditions
Discounted or free shift meals Expectations:
Everyone working in our restaurant is expected to:
Contribute to working in a team environment where everyone is valued and respected.
Communicate well with coworkers, team leaders, and management. Communication is vital to everything running as smoothly as possible and any potential issues being addressed in the “controlled-chaos” that is a busy restaurant.
Embrace and support our core collaborative value of tip pooling. We believe that all hourly employees are important to creating a memorable guest experience and should share in customer tips. It is also our experience that this collaborative effort breaks down barriers and wage disparities that can exist between the “front and back houses” of some restaurants to the detriment of the guest experience and work environment.
Demonstrate product and operational knowledge and perform well during high volume periods.
Maintain required permits such as food handler’s permit and demonstrate knowledge of health code regulations.
Remain coachable and eager to improve the quality of the service and products we provide.
Assist with house-keeping tasks to keep our work environment clean, safe and properly functioning. Tutta Bella Crew members specifically are expected to:
Hone your craft, pizza making is an art… constantly strive to improve your techniques and celebrate the accomplishments of everyone on our team.
Ensure the quality of the food leaving the kitchen. Maintain our standards and always strive for perfection, every time.
Constantly strive to improve your engagements with guests.
Anticipate and respond to guest needs and be sensitive to special needs and requests.
Adhere to all recipes and procedures as trained.
Follow all safety and health department guidelines and our procedures around them such as completing line checks and cooling charts.
Be at least 16 years of age. Working Conditions:
Position requires prolonged standing, bending, stooping, twisting, and lifting products and supplies weighing up to 50 pounds and repetitive hand and wrist motion. Can include working outdoors in various temperatures. Also, work with sharp and hazardous equipment as well as work with phones, computers, and other office equipment.

Support Cashier
Brand: White House Black Market
Category: Cashier
Location:
Washington Square, Tigard, OR 
Support Cashier The Support Cashier is responsible for performing various functions that support the sales operations of the stores which will consist of primarily POS transactions but could also include merchandise handling, stock processing, and stockroom organization. Receives, stores, and replenishes sales floor merchandise and stocks merchandise. May periodically work sales floor. FUNCTIONAL RESPONSIBILITIES:
1. Performs various sales and register transactions including ringing purchases, processing of cash or credit payments and counting money.
2. Maintains an awareness of customers to both increase service levels and reduce security risks; remains current on policies regarding payment and exchanges, and security practices.
3. Participates in pricing changes and mark-downs; presents merchandise according to pricing and visual standards and direction.
4. Greets and assists customers; responds to customer inquiries and complaints in a professional and timely manner; resolves customer questions/concerns to their satisfaction. Resolve customer questions/concerns to their satisfaction; keeps abreast of guiding principles and POS system changes.
5. Processes freight ensuring items are properly stored, ticketed and easily located for replenishment for the sales floor, reorganizes merchandise as needed to maximize stock space. 7. Correctly enters all receiving documents into the computer system, reconciles merchandise invoices to items received as applicable. Accurately and timely completes store-to-store transfers and Locate requests.
8. Ensures the visual packet materials, props and signage are received and processed in a timely manner, properly stores stockroom hardware, hangers, sign holders, etc.
9. Other duties as assigned/required. QUALIFICATIONS:
1. Must be 18 years of age or older
2. High school diploma or equivalent
3. Previous stock or cashier experience preferred
4. Excellent communication skills
5. Excellent customer service skills
6. Strong organizational skills and ability to multi-task in a fast-paced environment
7. Must be able to work the majority of the shift standing
8. Ability to work quickly and within strict timelines
9. Ability to demonstrate teamwork
10. Exposure to visual merchandising and product placement techniques desired
11. Communicate with customers, Associates, and Management; wear / communicate with headset; stand and maneuver around sales floor and stockroom; operate register; lift and carry 30 pounds; hang / fold merchandise; climb, reach, push / pull, and clean
12. Regular attendance is essential to this position in order to ensure adequate coverage to meet company objectives. Ability to work a flexible work schedule, including nights, weekends, and holidays is required.


Under the directions of the Keno Manager, the Supervisor oversees the day-to-day operation of the Keno personnel on the shift. The supervisor verifies and approves winnings for payouts. Maintains accountability for the impress bank and is the first line for handling guest disputes. DUTIES: Provides Clearly Superior Customer Service to all internal and external customers. Ensures the operation of the Keno area is efficient and in accordance with department's policies and procedures and the Tribal-State Compact. Ensures compliance with all Class III gaming regulations. Assists the Keno Manager in the development of policy and procedure manuals for Keno operations. Monitors said manuals in an effort to quickly handle disputes and train new personnel. May Assist the manager in developing schedules and various aspects of monitoring employee performance. Keeps management informed relative to customer and employee relations. Rechecks tickets upon request. Responsible for opening and closing games including the completion of required reports. Pays winning tickets. Responsible for cash transaction during assigned shift. Barista
Dote’s baristas are responsible for delivering on our Company promise to create a welcoming place for the community to relax and connect. This role is responsible for all business execution during their shift including drink making, food service, cash handling, cleaning, display and awesome customer service.
Responsibilities
· Problem solve and use good judgment
· Set an example of top notch service and barista skills every day, including:
-Skilled drink making and coffee QC
-Deliver great service
-Welcome and thank every customer
-Offer customers samples, menu suggestions, and add-ons with a smile
-Uncompromising product quality every single time
-Keep calm and barista on when it gets busy
-Hustle to keep shop looking ‘clean & ready’ at all times (clean bar, clean
towels, no dishes, no crumbs, no clutter, hoppers full, pastries full, tags
displayed)
-Continually stock coffee, paper goods, pastries, retail coffee & chocolate as it’s purchased
-Operate cash register; follow cash handling procedures
-Wash bar equipment and dishes throughout your shift
-Keep shop inviting and clean: inside and out, front and back
-Follow health, safety, and sanitation guidelines with care
-Other duties as assigned
Qualifications
· Minimum 2 years barista or bartending experience required
· Positive personality
· Willingness to pick up shifts, as needed
· Have great communication skills and a professional, friendly attitude
·Retail or client/customer service experience a plus
· Be over 18 in order to work late nights.
Culture
This job is really fun with great co-workers and awesome customers. At times, this job, like any in a growing small business, is also stressful. The shop gets busy and stays busy so keeping your cool even when it’s hot in the shop is critical. Positive stress management attitudes and techniques, while working hard alongside the rest of the team, are a must.

The Cook's Helper provides support services for cafeteria, production, and or patient care areas. Positions include but are not limited to grill, cashier, deli, salad bar, nutrition services aid, pantry aide, and catering. Responsibilities include, but not limited to: 1. Preparation and serving of sufficient hot and cold food for patients, cafeteria and catering and/or mini deli areas. 2. Replenishing food and supplies in cafeteria, catering and/or patient food service areas. 3. Setting up catered functions and delivering coffee. 4. Cashing and keeping cash records. 5. Setting up, opening, and closing of cafeteria and/or mini deli. 6. Delivering and picking up tray carts on nursing units. 7. Delivering patient menus.
REQUIRED for the position:
High school graduate or equivalent combination of education and experience
A valid Washington State "Food and Beverage Workers" Permit
Knowledge of safety, sanitation and food-handling standards and practices.
1 year of recent food service and cashiering work experience OR any combination of experience and education that would demonstrate the capability to perform the duties
Must be able to effectively communicate with customers, fellow employees and other departments.
Ability to establish and maintain effective working relationships.
Ability to multi task in a fast paced, constantly changing environment
Capable of efficient time management.
Ability to provide excellent customer service.
Basic math skills (addition, subtraction, multiplication, division) for cash handling purposes.
Basic understanding of POS functionality.
This position is covered by a collective bargaining agreement between EvergreenHealth and the Service Employees International Union (SEIU) Healthcare 1199NW. Union membershp is optional.


SUMMARY: Provides guest service by properly seating guests at their tables, cleans dining areas and assists Food and Beverage staff as needed. DUTIES: Sees to all the needs of the dining guests by providing clearly superior customer service. Ability to learn and follow the room rotation system for seating guests. Assists in keeping the host/hostess area clean and organized. Actively practices the customer service standards. Assists co workers with rolling silverware and other assigned side work duties. Greets guests and answers questions. Makes all cash transactions, gives change and cash out till. Assist guests with comps and food specials Coupons, two-for-one etc. Assists with reservations. QUALIFICATIONS: High School Diploma or GED. Some food preparation training is helpful. Food Handlers Card required. One 1 year of experience in Food and Beverage industry.

Duties
Summary
The primary function of this position is to perform hostess/cashiering tasks. Incumbent greets guests, escorts them to table, alerting server that table has been seated.
Responsibilities
The primary function of this position is to perform hostess/cashiering tasks. Incumbent greets guests, escorts them to table, alerting server that table has been seated. Coordinate activities involved in setting up for parties/catered events. May make table reservations for patrons as appropriate. Incumbent responsibilities include preparation of menu boards, secure supplies, etc. for operation of facility. Ensures adequate change fund is on hand; takes food and drink orders from patrons. Assist in maintaining good order and discipline. Answer patron’s questions in pleasant, courteous manner. Ensure proper preparation, display and price marking of items and adherence to correct receipt and pricing procedures. Maintains sales records and inventory on daily basis. Follow procedure for safeguarding cash. Ensure compliance with fire, safety, sanitation and security regulations. Incumbent will perform some housekeeping duties, including washing dishes, sweeping floors, wiping down tables and taking out trash. Rings sales and/or ticket sales by individual items, totals the sales, receives money, and makes change. Incumbent is responsible for turning in receipts at the end of each shift. Monitors operation of assigned area of responsibility, periodically checking to identify and resolve problems which may arise. Enforce rules. Handle all phone inquiries. Incumbent ensures customer satisfaction. Perform other duties as assigned.

Not required

Barista
Dote’s baristas are responsible for delivering on our Company promise to create a welcoming place for the community to relax and connect. This role is responsible for all business execution during their shift including drink making, food service, cash handling, cleaning, display and awesome customer service.
Responsibilities
· Problem solve and use good judgment
· Set an example of top notch service and barista skills every day, including:
-Skilled drink making and coffee QC
-Deliver great service
-Welcome and thank every customer
-Offer customers samples, menu suggestions, and add-ons with a smile
-Uncompromising product quality every single time
-Keep calm and barista on when it gets busy
-Hustle to keep shop looking ‘clean & ready’ at all times (clean bar, clean
towels, no dishes, no crumbs, no clutter, hoppers full, pastries full, tags
displayed)
-Continually stock coffee, paper goods, pastries, retail coffee & chocolate as it’s purchased
-Operate cash register; follow cash handling procedures
-Wash bar equipment and dishes throughout your shift
-Keep shop inviting and clean: inside and out, front and back
-Follow health, safety, and sanitation guidelines with care
-Other duties as assigned
Qualifications
· Minimum 2 years barista or bartending experience required
· Positive personality
· Willingness to pick up shifts, as needed
· Have great communication skills and a professional, friendly attitude
·Retail or client/customer service experience a plus
· Be over 18 in order to work late nights.
Culture
This job is really fun with great co-workers and awesome customers. At times, this job, like any in a growing small business, is also stressful. The shop gets busy and stays busy so keeping your cool even when it’s hot in the shop is critical. Positive stress management attitudes and techniques, while working hard alongside the rest of the team, are a must.
Job Type: Full-time
Salary: $12.50 to $14.00 /hour
Experience:
Barista or Bartending: 2 years (Required)
Customer Service: 1 year (Preferred)
Additional Compensation:
Tips
Work Location:
One location
Tip income:
Yes
Schedule:
Monday to Friday
Weekends required
Day shift
Night shift
8 hour shift

Support Cashier
Brand: White House Black Market
Category: Cashier
Location:
Washington Square, Tigard, OR 
Support Cashier The Support Cashier is responsible for performing various functions that support the sales operations of the stores which will consist of primarily POS transactions but could also include merchandise handling, stock processing, and stockroom organization. Receives, stores, and replenishes sales floor merchandise and stocks merchandise. May periodically work sales floor. FUNCTIONAL RESPONSIBILITIES:
1. Performs various sales and register transactions including ringing purchases, processing of cash or credit payments and counting money.
2. Maintains an awareness of customers to both increase service levels and reduce security risks; remains current on policies regarding payment and exchanges, and security practices.
3. Participates in pricing changes and mark-downs; presents merchandise according to pricing and visual standards and direction.
4. Greets and assists customers; responds to customer inquiries and complaints in a professional and timely manner; resolves customer questions/concerns to their satisfaction. Resolve customer questions/concerns to their satisfaction; keeps abreast of guiding principles and POS system changes.
5. Processes freight ensuring items are properly stored, ticketed and easily located for replenishment for the sales floor, reorganizes merchandise as needed to maximize stock space. 7. Correctly enters all receiving documents into the computer system, reconciles merchandise invoices to items received as applicable. Accurately and timely completes store-to-store transfers and Locate requests.
8. Ensures the visual packet materials, props and signage are received and processed in a timely manner, properly stores stockroom hardware, hangers, sign holders, etc.
9. Other duties as assigned/required. QUALIFICATIONS:
1. Must be 18 years of age or older
2. High school diploma or equivalent
3. Previous stock or cashier experience preferred
4. Excellent communication skills
5. Excellent customer service skills
6. Strong organizational skills and ability to multi-task in a fast-paced environment
7. Must be able to work the majority of the shift standing
8. Ability to work quickly and within strict timelines
9. Ability to demonstrate teamwork
10. Exposure to visual merchandising and product placement techniques desired
11. Communicate with customers, Associates, and Management; wear / communicate with headset; stand and maneuver around sales floor and stockroom; operate register; lift and carry 30 pounds; hang / fold merchandise; climb, reach, push / pull, and clean
12. Regular attendance is essential to this position in order to ensure adequate coverage to meet company objectives. Ability to work a flexible work schedule, including nights, weekends, and holidays is required.

ISSAQUAH SCHOOL DISTRICT JOB DESCRIPTION
TITLE: Food Service Baker/Cashier DEPARTMENT: Food Service Department
*
REPORTS TO: *Director of Food Services
POSITION SUMMARY: The Food Service Baker/Cashier is responsible for completion of all baking functions as well as all cashier responsibilities.
ESSENTIAL FUNCTIONS:
 Collect money and tickets for the daily lunch.
 Supervise the use of tickets in the line.
 Collect and verify all money collected during the day and prepare deposit.
 Complete the daily meal and cash report necessary to produce the monthly state and federal reimbursement reports.
 Maintain the complete financial records for the food service site.
 Communicate known changes regarding free and reduced applications to the food service office.
 Prepare quick breads, yeast breads and desserts according to standardized recipes.
 Operate necessary kitchen equipment. (mixers, ovens, etc.)
 Assist Manager in adapting recipes to fit needed quantities.
 Order and maintain necessary baker and cashier supplies.
 Maintain the highest standards of sanitation and safety in the kitchen.
 Possess knowledge of and adhere to Governing Policies and District Regulations and Procedures.
 Participate in special projects as assigned and perform related duties and key responsibilities consistent with the scope and intent of the position.
 Perform other duties as assigned.
QUALIFICATIONS:
EDUCATION: High school diploma or equivalent.
EXPERIENCE: Job related experience is preferable.
ABILITIES: Ability to lift 25 – 30 pounds on a regular basis
REQUIRED TESTING: None specified
CERTIFICATES AND LICENSES: Valid Food Handlers Permit. Valid WA State driver’s license and appropriate insurance required. Must maintain as current any certification or license listed herein and held at hire date.
CLEARANCES: Criminal Justice fingerprint/Background Clearance
FLSA STATUS: Non-exempt
BARGAINING UNIT: United Classified Workers of Washington, Issaquah Chapter
UPDATED JAN. 2018 Page 1* of 1*
Job Type: Full-time
Experience:
food service: 1 year (Preferred)
Baking: 1 year (Preferred)
Education:
High school or equivalent (Preferred)

On our Team, everyone plays a critical role. Your Mission (and Ours) is to serve and inspire athletes and outdoor enthusiasts to achieve their personal best through the relentless improvement of everything we do. Sales Associate Duties:
Create a world-class customer experience by providing passionate customer service and selling through customer engagement, specifically (but not limited to) the Golf Department
Uphold company standards for merchandise presentation of the best apparel and equipment brands in sporting goods
Demonstrate ability to genuinely interact with customers to show passion, knowledge, dedication, and commitment in their sport or activity
Promote company programs including warranty sales, Scorecard (loyalty program), private-label credit cards, and other seasonal promotions

Qualifications

Join the Tutta Bella Crew at our new counter concept in Kirkland Urban. We are bringing our traditional wood fired pizzas that made us Northwest famous and adding some delicious grab and go items to our new location inside the next generation Kirkland Urban QFC - right next to their Q20 brew pub.
Tutta Bella Crew members work at our counter service concepts either demonstrating the pizzaiolo skills to slap and open the dough, top the pizzas and cook them in our Italian wood fired ovens or performing the customer facing skills necessary to provide our guests with a memorable experience and helping with cutting pizzas, etc... or ideally, both. In addition to our Neapolitan pizzas, the Tutta Bella Crew will be providing guests with Italian sandwiches, lasagna, salads, tiramisu and fresh Sicilian cannoli from our counter service location. Ultimately Tutta Bella Crew members are responsible for executing our purpose of “Nourishing lives by sharing traditions, authentic food and love,” and providing a memorable guest experience to every guest. The way we accomplish this is through our adherence to Neapolitan traditions, following our proven recipes and systems, showing genuine care for our guests and teammates, and enjoying making people happy. Benefits:
Friendly, supportive work environments
Advancement in a growing company (if you want it)
Competitive compensation & benefits
Training in scratch cooking & centuries-old culinary traditions
Discounted or free shift meals Expectations:
Everyone working in our restaurant is expected to:
Contribute to working in a team environment where everyone is valued and respected.
Communicate well with coworkers, team leaders, and management. Communication is vital to everything running as smoothly as possible and any potential issues being addressed in the “controlled-chaos” that is a busy restaurant.
Embrace and support our core collaborative value of tip pooling. We believe that all hourly employees are important to creating a memorable guest experience and should share in customer tips. It is also our experience that this collaborative effort breaks down barriers and wage disparities that can exist between the “front and back houses” of some restaurants to the detriment of the guest experience and work environment.
Demonstrate product and operational knowledge and perform well during high volume periods.
Maintain required permits such as food handler’s permit and demonstrate knowledge of health code regulations.
Remain coachable and eager to improve the quality of the service and products we provide.
Assist with house-keeping tasks to keep our work environment clean, safe and properly functioning. Tutta Bella Crew members specifically are expected to:
Hone your craft, pizza making is an art… constantly strive to improve your techniques and celebrate the accomplishments of everyone on our team.
Ensure the quality of the food leaving the kitchen. Maintain our standards and always strive for perfection, every time.
Constantly strive to improve your engagements with guests.
Anticipate and respond to guest needs and be sensitive to special needs and requests.
Adhere to all recipes and procedures as trained.
Follow all safety and health department guidelines and our procedures around them such as completing line checks and cooling charts.
Be at least 16 years of age. Working Conditions:
Position requires prolonged standing, bending, stooping, twisting, and lifting products and supplies weighing up to 50 pounds and repetitive hand and wrist motion. Can include working outdoors in various temperatures. Also, work with sharp and hazardous equipment as well as work with phones, computers, and other office equipment.


Oversees the operation of the Slot Department during assigned shift. Ensures good quality customer service to Cage/Slots Department. Handles cash transactions and provides Clearly Supervisor Customer Service to guests. DUTIES: Responsible for ensuring the opening and closing of games, including completion of all required reports. Responsible for scheduling staff, handling employee disputes and training new employees. Responsible for signing in and out necessary keys for assigned shift. Providing assistance to new customers on game rules and operation of machines. Performs all duties in accordance with Clearly Superior Customer Service standards. Maintain custody of the Cashier's inventory of currency, coins, tokens, forms, documents and records transactions accurately at cashier's station or as Floor Attendant. Performs cash transactions and provides floor support as necessary. Cashes out jackpots under the direct supervision of the Shift Manager. Effectively, efficiently and professionally communicates with coworkers using a radio. Perfoms basic troubleshooting on Player Terminals. QUALIFICATIONS: High School diploma or GED. Retail or customer service experience required. A minimum of 2 yrs. gaming experience or supervisory experience required. A minimum of 2 yrs. large volume cash handling experience is preferred coupled with a fast-paced business environment.


Under the directions of the Keno Manager, the Supervisor oversees the day-to-day operation of the Keno personnel on the shift. The supervisor verifies and approves winnings for payouts. Maintains accountability for the impress bank and is the first line for handling guest disputes. DUTIES: Provides Clearly Superior Customer Service to all internal and external customers. Ensures the operation of the Keno area is efficient and in accordance with department's policies and procedures and the Tribal-State Compact. Ensures compliance with all Class III gaming regulations. Assists the Keno Manager in the development of policy and procedure manuals for Keno operations. Monitors said manuals in an effort to quickly handle disputes and train new personnel. May Assist the manager in developing schedules and various aspects of monitoring employee performance. Keeps management informed relative to customer and employee relations. Rechecks tickets upon request. Responsible for opening and closing games including the completion of required reports. Pays winning tickets. Responsible for cash transaction during assigned shift. QUALIFICATIONS: High School Diploma or GED required.

Responsibilities:
Answer emails and making phone calls, about general enrollment , reschedule and follow up.Re-engaging inactive members
Take payments, archive, tracking payments; Input registration document online and stay organized.
Staying updated on promotions: Renew art display twice a month; Seasonal decoration; Seaonal poster and flyers publishing
Liaison between our studios, business vendors and educational institutions.
Help instructors to track students attendance during rush hours. Help manager scheduling staff occasionally.
Clean up and set up for classes/camp/party together with art instructors during rush hours.
As a candidate, we’d like you to have:
Have a strong customer service orientation and be able to communicate effectively with students parents, prospective clients, vendors, and team. Maintain client confidentiality.
Have a high school diploma or equivalent (GED).Possess basic math and cash handling experience. Good at Excel.
Art background or daycare/school working experience is a plus.
Must consent to a nationwide criminal background check.

SUMMARY: Provides guest service by properly seating guests at their tables, cleans dining areas and assists Food and Beverage staff as needed. DUTIES: Sees to all the needs of the dining guests by providing clearly superior customer service. Ability to learn and follow the room rotation system for seating guests. The Cook's Helper provides support services for cafeteria, production, and or patient care areas. Positions include but are not limited to grill, cashier, deli, salad bar, nutrition services aid, pantry aide, and catering. Responsibilities include, but not limited to: 1. Preparation and serving of sufficient hot and cold food for patients, cafeteria and catering and/or mini deli areas. 2. Replenishing food and supplies in cafeteria, catering and/or patient food service areas. 3. Setting up catered functions and delivering coffee. 4. Cashing and keeping cash records. 5. Setting up, opening, and closing of cafeteria and/or mini deli. 6. Delivering and picking up tray carts on nursing units. 7. Delivering patient menus.
REQUIRED for the position:
High school graduate or equivalent combination of education and experience
A valid Washington State "Food and Beverage Workers" Permit
Knowledge of safety, sanitation and food-handling standards and practices.
1 year of recent food service and cashiering work experience OR any combination of experience and education that would demonstrate the capability to perform the duties
Must be able to effectively communicate with customers, fellow employees and other departments.
Ability to establish and maintain effective working relationships.
Ability to multi task in a fast paced, constantly changing environment
Capable of efficient time management.
Ability to provide excellent customer service.
Basic math skills (addition, subtraction, multiplication, division) for cash handling purposes.
Basic understanding of POS functionality.
This position is covered by a collective bargaining agreement between EvergreenHealth and the Service Employees International Union (SEIU) Healthcare 1199NW. Union membershp is optional.


Job Summary:
The Cook's Helper provides support services for cafeteria, production, and or patient care areas.
Positions include but are not limited to grill, cashier, deli, salad bar, nutrition services aid, pantry aide, and catering. Responsibilities include, but not limited to:
1. Preparation and serving of sufficient hot and cold food for patients, cafeteria and catering and/or mini deli areas.
2. Replenishing food and supplies in cafeteria, catering and/or patient food service areas.
3. Setting up catered functions and delivering coffee.
4. Cashing and keeping cash records.
5. Setting up, opening, and closing of cafeteria and/or mini deli.
6. Delivering and picking up tray carts on nursing units.
7. Delivering patient menus. REQUIRED for the position:
High school graduate or equivalent combination of education and experience
A valid Washington State "Food and Beverage Workers" Permit
Knowledge of safety, sanitation and food-handling standards and practices.
1 year of recent food service and cashiering work experience OR any combination of experience and education that would demonstrate the capability to perform the duties
Must be able to effectively communicate with customers, fellow employees and other departments.
Ability to establish and maintain effective working relationships.
Ability to multi task in a fast paced, constantly changing environment
Capable of efficient time management.
Ability to provide excellent customer service.
Basic math skills (addition, subtraction, multiplication, division) for cash handling purposes.
Basic understanding of POS functionality. This position is covered by a collective bargaining agreement between EvergreenHealth and the Service Employees International Union (SEIU) Healthcare 1199NW. Union membershp is optional. Location: Evergreen Healthcare · Food and Nutrition Services
Schedule: Per Diem, Varies, per diem


We are genuine in our belief that sports make people better and so are you! Immerse yourself in a workplace that loves to be active and lives the brand. Associates joining our team have an opportunity to be a part of the #1 sporting goods retailer in the country and create a lasting impact on their communities through sport and activity.
On our Team, everyone plays a critical role. Your Mission (and Ours) is to serve and inspire athletes and outdoor enthusiasts to achieve their personal best through the relentless improvement of everything we do.
Sales Associate Duties:
Create a world-class customer experience by providing passionate customer service and selling through customer engagement, specifically (but not limited to) our Bike & Fitness Departments
Uphold company standards for merchandise presentation of the best apparel and equipment brands in sporting goods
Demonstrate ability to genuinely interact with customers to show passion, knowledge, dedication, and commitment in their sport or activity
Promote company programs including warranty sales, Scorecard (loyalty program), private-label credit cards, and other seasonal promotions
As business needs arise, other tasks may become necessary
Qualifications
Success Profile:
Flexible availability – including nights, weekend, and holidays
1-2 years of Retail Cashier, Retail Sales, or cash-handling experience preferred
Passion for Bikes and/or Fitness Click HERE to review our Rewards & Benefits Information DICK’S Sporting Goods is an Equal Opportunity Employer.
